Susan Storm/Richards the beautiful blue eyed, blond haired Invisible Woman is known across New York city and the marvel universe in general as a not only one of its first and superheroines, but also one of the most attractive, especially for a mother of two.

12.title: Susan Richards/The Invisible Woman.

Just stuff herself with food like a normal person would.
121.content:
Susan sighed a bit as she observed her body in the full size mirror in her bedroom.

It had been a whirlwind month for the superhero family. Galactus had hunger pains yet again, Namor had attempted to kidnap Sue once more, and the Mole Man had tried to steal the Grand Canyon. Luckily through the efforts of Reed, Johnny, Ben, and Sue they had prevailed. But the ordeal had left them all exhausted.

Susan was examining her body because lately she had found herself to be unattractive. Of course she still looked as fit and trim as a supermodel but to her own eyes something was missing.

Her thoughts were halted when the bellowing voice of Ben Grimm rang out, calling all of them to dinner. Now normally the thought of Ben Grimm making anything would be cause for alarm but Thing had been working on his cooking skills to impress his new girlfriend Blair, who was dining with the family tonight.

But what met Sue's eyes as she made her way down to the table wasn't a meal. It was a feast.

There were roast turkies, hams, pies of all descriptions, french fries, bratwurst, hot dogs, hamburgers, salads, salmon, in short every food that every member of the family could ask for.

Reed, Johnny, Franklin, and Valeria were already there along with Blair and Ben and when they saw Susan they ushered her to sit down. Doing so, Ben soon handed her a plate loaded with food.

A bit nervous and after saying a quick thanks for the food, she dug in.

The taste was incredible, fantastic even!

Soon enough Susan had polished off the first plate and went for seconds. That plate was finished faster than Reed could solve the function of pi and soon a third and fourth plate joined it.

The end result was Susan's stuffed stomach, though looking around at the table, she wasn't the only one who had stuffed herself.

After dinner and still stuffed, Susan returned to the mirror, cradling her distended gut. Gut it was for the round orb filled to the brim with food could not honestly be called a stomach.

Susan liked what she saw and for a moment she thought she might be crazy. Fat looked good on her.

But the crazy moniker soon vanished as she struck a few poses, replaced with a determination.

She liked her big belly. If she liked her stuffed stomach so much, how much would she admire her butt when it was larger? Or her thighs? Or her face surrounded by fat?

One would think that Susan was under the enchantment of some villain for her to be thinking these odd thoughts but such wasn't the case here.

Susan Storm was going to get fat!

But how should she do it?
121.title: Susan was looking at herself in a mirror....

1212.content:
"Franklin, honey?"

It was the next day and Franklin was watching a cowboy movie on the television.

"Yeah, mom?"

For a moment Sue wished he still called her mommy. But Franklin was twelve now and beyond that phase of childhood.

"Remember how your father and I told you not to use your powers anymore?"

"Yeah, but it's hard not to sometimes."

"I know. Well I was wondering if....maybe...you would be willing to use them again."

Franklin now fully looked at his mother, a smile on his face.

"I'd love to! What did you have in mind?"

Susan was blushing now and looked around, hoping no one else was around to hear.

"I want you to make me fat."

Franklin blinked a few times. His neurons fired but he still couldn't process what he just heard. "You...fat...want to be?"

Susan nodded, smiling a bit as she confessed to another person her desire.

"Yes! I want to have a gut! I want to not be able to see my own feet no matter how hard I try. I want my butt to fill up three chairs! I want my thighs to touch no matter how far apart I spread them!"

That last image caused Franklin to wince and his adolescent disgust brought him back to reality.

"Really?"

Susan nodded again. "Think of it as a trial run. Make me fat for six months and if I don't like it I'll let you know."

"Do you want dad and the rest of the world to know that you became fat or do you want them to think that you've always been huge?"

"Always been huge," Susan answered.

Franklin nodded and closed his eyes.

"Alright, when I open my eyes again you'll have the body you just described. But it's going to be tricky to pull off. Also I don't know how this will affect the rest of the world. But after six months I'll ask you and if you're happy with it then that's the way reality will stay, alright?"

Susan nodded and couldn't wait for her son to open his eyes.

Franklin did so and gasped a bit.

Susan Storm had the body she had asked for. Her butt, by far the largest part of her now, stuck out like two beach balls. Her stomach was separated into two huge rolls. Her face had four chins.

She was obese.

And she didn't know what to do next...
1212.title: Ask Franklin to use his reality warping powers ...

12122.content:
Eventually, after feeling every new flabby part of her body, Susan decided to call up one of her closest friends, Jennifer Walters aka She-Hulk.

The video screen technology she used to do so was one of Sue's favorite inventions her husband had come up with and when her green-skinned friend answered, Susan's eyes widened.

"Jennfier, you're huge!"

Indeed, She-Hulk was huge. In this reality Jennifer Walters had become the She-Bulk, her transformation causing permanent, irreversible weight gain. But her personality was the same as she smiled warmly at Susan.

"Of course I am! I'm the She-Bulk and the baddies fear my big butt!"

After sharing a laugh with Jennifer, Susan made plans to meet for lunch with Jennifer, Electra, Black Cat, Scarlet Witch, and Tigra.

Hanging up, Susan went to look for her husband.

She found him, as usual, in his lab. But he had changed. Whereas Reed Richards was normally skinny, the Reed before Susan was huge! His butt was nearly as big as hers, he had four chins that jiggled as he smiled at his wife, and a big gut!

"Reed...how are you?"

"Never better honey! But it was kind of hard to get down to the lab today."

Reed stretched then, the elastic body of his doing little to prevent the fat man from sweating heavily as he did so.

Susan was a bit concerned at the sight of her fat husband but figured that Franklin wouldn't make his father suffer just because of her wish. But Susan was really worried when she saw the Flabby Torch and The Fat. Johnny was fat largely in his belly and he had man boobs which jiggled every time he moved, much to Susan's amusement.

Ben had the largest butt she'd ever seen but he was still rocky.

The sight of her two transformed family members and her husband had initially worried Susan but that worry died down as she noticed all of them enjoying their fat and going about their lives as normally as they usually did.

She was so caught up in making sure that the rest of the guys were okay as flabby heroes that she nearly missed her lunch date. Luckily though, Susan wasn't late and spied her five fellow females already seated around a large table, easily fitting their huge bodies around it.

And what bodies!

She Hulk's gain had surprised her but the rest were equally stunning. Electra's butt was larger than Ben's for crying out loud to say nothing of her stomach. The ninja smiled at Susan as they both ate a large chocolate cake. Tigra's weight was distributed all over much like Susan's, and the cat-woman purred as she ate five salmon. Wanda Maximoff, or the Scarlet Witch, was plowing through eight pieces of fried chicken and getting grease all over her uniform, not that she cared. Wanda's weight was focused on her belly, the round orb just beating Johnny's big gut though Wanda's butt, thighs, fat face, and chins were huge as well.

Susan observed all of her fat friends as they all ate and smiled.

1212212.content:
Sue had so much fun indulging in her new appetite that she actually managed to out-eat most of her friends. While Tigra, Elektra, Wanda, and Felicia were waddling their way to the bathroom, she and Jen were still chowing down on cakes and pies. It seemed to be something of a competition between them. After about an hour, the Immobile Woman{as she had now elected to call herself} finally stopped to moan in pleasure at her divine meal, only to have it turn into a rather audible burp.

Sue blushed with embarrassment and covered her mouth. "I'm so sorry, Jen!" She-bulk raised an eyebrow at her friend. "You should be, girl...because that was weak!" Jennifer proceeded to suck in a breath and unleash a mighty belch of her own. The force of it blew Sue's hair back and cleared the table of it's dishes. "Top that!"

Sue looked dejectedly at what remained of her half-eaten cake on the floor. Then, she thought better of it and flashed She-Bulk an impish smirk. "Okay Jen, if that's how you want to play!" She would've never fancied her chances in a belching contest before, let alone one with She-hulk, but thing were much different now. She was the Immobile Woman!

The "Fat-tastic" Four's blonde matriarch picked up what was left of her drink and chugged it as fast as she was able. She then copied Jen's technique and sucked in a deep breath. The result?
"BUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUU UUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURP!"
Sue's belch echoed through the restaurant and into the street outside, lasting two full minutes. She laughed when it was done, having never had so much fun in her entire life. Jen was laughing too.

"Now that's the Sue I know. But you better strap in, girl, because I'm just gettin' warmed up!" Sue only grinned in response. "Bring it on!"

12131.content:
Standing invisibly atop a force-field platform, Sue quietly went down to the fridge. It was 11:00 p.m., and Sue didn't wish to wake anyone with her snack session. Reaching the fridge, Sue tip-toed off of her invisible platform, resuming visibility. Sue opened the fridge and pulled out the object of her desire: a carton of vanilla ice cream. Using a system of fore fields to quietly bring herself a spoon, Sue sat down against the fridge, opened the carton, and dug in.

Sue was still fairly full from dinner, as was evident by her still bulging gut. Sue, however, was determined to eat the entire contents of the carton. With a quick grace, she dug in.

She was about a quarter finished with the carton when she began to feel full. This only fueled Sue's determination to finish the carton. Steeling her resolve, Sue doubled her speed, shoveling spoonful after delicious spoonful into her mouth and down to her gullet. By the time she was half-finished, Sue's belly was burgeoning out from behind her pajama bottoms. She rubbed the bottom curve of it soothingly, then resumed her feast. As soon as she finished, Sue lay down in victory, rubbing her immense food baby. Her pajama top could not contain the entirety of the gargantuan gut Sue was now sporting, coming to an end a little above her belly button. After a few minutes of rubbing her belly, Sue stood up, threw away the empty carton, and carried herself back to bed.
12131.title: To Eat, Or Not To Eat? It's Not A Question—EAT.

121312.content:
The next week was a slow one for the Fantastic Four and so that gave Susan plenty of time to indulge her newly gained sweet tooth and her desire to plump herself up.

None of her teammates had yet commented on the changes to Sue's figure but she could tell they were one and all eying her rather strangely at times. Granted some times Susan felt like eying her own new figure rather strangely as well.

Despite the fact that she'd been making sure to stuff herself with a nice fattening desert every chance she got the Invisible Woman wasn't getting fat, at least not normally fat. Instead it seemed as though almost all of the weight that she gained was centered in her belly. This gave Susan an enormously great gut that would easily burst through any outfit not made of unstable molecules but it hadn't caused her arms, legs, ass, or breasts to increase in size at least not much.

Every now and again Susan contemplated the idea of paying her husband a visit to take a look at her body and try to figure out exactly what was going on with it, but she didn't since it would doubtlessly lead into unwanted questions about why she had decided to gain weight in the first place. So instead for the moment Susan just lounged on her bed both hands stroking her almost beachball sized belly wondering exactly what was going inside of her...

1213122.content:
It was a calm Saturday morning when Susan found that her jeans would not fit.

It wasn't like they fit before—Susan's belly would never allow for them to button—but now they were just too tight. Before, they could make it up her legs and up to her waist with incredible ease, but it took Susan a great struggle to get them up her legs today, and they stopped just a little below her hips. Susan examined herself in the mirror.

Her jeans constricted her legs tightly. If she stood stock-still, the silhouette would resemble that of an ice-cream cone. Her arms had lost most of their muscle definition, appearing to be a lot softer and slightly thicker. Her bosom had experienced minimal change, but they were in proportion with the rest of her. Susan turned for a back-side view.

Her derriere was a lot rounder than she remembered, straining against her jeans. Nothing would be able to fit in the rear pockets, since the material was spread to maximum capacity. Her back formed little folds of fat against the white T-shirt she was wearing, her love handles quite prominent. With another twirl, Susan expected her belly.

It was a bit smaller than yesterday, almost as if it had transferred some of its mass to other parts of Susan's body. However, the globular gut was still quite large, refusing to be covered by her shirt anywhere past her belly button. It formed a small muffin top above Susan's jeans.

With a delighted smile, Susan changed into a pair of sweatpants.

I'm finally getting fat!
1213122.title: Finally!

Or do you want to do something else?
12131222.content:
"This is cute," Susan said softly to herself, holding up a Spider-Man T-shirt. "Although the web design is a bit inaccurate." Folding it up, Susan placed it in her bag, turning invisible and moving on to the pants' section.

Even in sweatpants, Susan's weight gain was quite prominent. Her belly had to be partially covered by her sweatpants—her shirt not being large enough to do so on its own—and even then, her love handles would ooze out from behind her shirt. Walking through the mall, she attracted her fair share of looks, managing to disappear before someone could take a photo. It wasn't that she hated her body—she just didn't want the attention that would come from her recent changes.

Susan grabbed a pair of size 16 black jeans, placed them in a concealing force field, and rushed to a changing room, resuming visibility as soon as she shut the door, not wanting to exhaust herself from extended use of her powers. Taking off her sweatpants, Susan tried on the jeans. They were a bit snug around her waist, a small muffin top present above her hips, but they could button up and were not nearly as constricting around her legs.

I'll take these for now, Susan thought, and grab a larger pair for later. Changing back into her sweatpants, Susan made her way to a checkout counter, grabbing a larger pair of jeans along the way. Paying for her clothes, Susan returned to the changing room to put on the Spider-Man T-shirt and the size 16 jeans. The shirt hid her muffin top and covered her belly, thankfully. Susan could almost hear Peter passive-aggressively joking about her added weight. Smiling, Susan put on a large sun hat and shades and left the mall.

As she was walking back to the Baxter Building, she came across a food truck selling shaved ice. Susan's stomach growled, and she remembered that she hadn't had breakfast yet.

Susan patted her belly. "Don't worry—I'll get you nice and full soon enough," she cooed. Susan made her way to the truck. Examining the menu, Susan made her decision.

"I'll have a chocolate shaved ice," she told the owner. And in less than a minute, she was chomping away on chocolate-flavored ice chips.

When she finished, she was still fairly hungry. She was about to return home to make breakfast herself when she came across a very interesting restaurant.

"The Superheroes' Repast," she read aloud. "Dress like a superhero, and get 50% off of your food. Actual superheroes eat for free." Susan looked up at the restaurant, mulling over whether or not she should go in.
12131222.title: Growing Into A New Wardrobe.

choices: In a room in the space between spaces, Susan is being watched…
Free choice.
121312221.content:
The deciding factor for Susan was something that had been influencing her decisions for the past week: her stomach. Having grown accustomed to large and frequent meals, being full of food had become the norm for it. While the shaved ice did satiate that hunger a little bit, it was not nearly enough. Susan's stomach wanted more, and it wanted it now. As such, it rumbled.

Susan looked down at her belly. Smiling, she gave the bulging layer of fat underneath her shirt a rub.

"I guess that answers that," she chuckled. And with that, she entered the restaurant.

She was greeted almost immediately by a waiter dressed as Spider-Man.

"Right this way, Mrs. Richards," he greeted, gesturing to a nearby table.

Following the direction of his gesture, Susan walked to the table, the waiter leading the way. Arriving at the table, the waiter pulled a chair out for Susan.

"Thank you," she said graciously before sitting down. The waiter bowed his head in acknowledgement and pulled out a notepad.

"So what can we get for our fine superheroine this morning?" he asked.

Normally, Susan would inquire about the options available to her, seeing as there was no menu. However, something compelled her to say the first thing to pop into her head.

"I'll have ten Belgian waffles, some hashbrowns, an omelette, a bowl of chocolate cereal, a dozen donuts, a slice of chocolate cake, a slice of chocolate pie, and a chocolate milkshake." Even though she had every intention to gain weight, the sheer amount of food she had asked for still stunned Susan.

The waiter scribbled this down in his notepad. "Anything else?"

"A box of chocolates." The words slipped out of Susan's mouth before she could even question the fact that the waiter could still ask Susan if she wanted more.

"It will be here shortly," the waiter informed Susan, shortly before leaving.

Turning her attention back from the table, Susan was surprised to find a box of chocolates sitting on the table. Before she could question the how, though, her hands grabbed and opened the box. It was a two-pound, circular box containing many different chocolates—milk, dark, creme-filled, caramel-filled, white, wafer, sea-salted, and more. Susan picked a disk of creme-filled milk chocolate and placed it in her mouth, chewing slowly. Her eyes widened.

"Mmm!" she moaned. The taste was probably the most delicious she had ever had the pleasure of experiencing, being sweet and fluffy but with an edge of cacao not usually found in milk chocolate. Upon swallowing, she had another. And another, and another, and another…

They're all so good! she thought, giddy with their delectability.

By the time she had emptied the box, Susan was fairly full. Within seconds of finishing the chocolates, the Spider-Man waiter returned, towing a cart loaded with the rest of Susan's order. Meticulously, he set the gloches around the table, removing the lids and putting them back in the cart. Unfolding a napkin, he wrapped it around Susan's neck like a bib.

"Please, enjoy your meal," he said, clasping his hands together. Taking the cart with him, he left Susan to have her breakfast.

Gazing down at her belly, Susan unbuttoned her jeans for what she knew would surely come. Rubbing her hands together in anticipation, Susan licked her lips and dug in.

She started with the cereal. Rotating the turntable on which all of the food was placed, Susan picked up the bowl and began slowly. Within the first two spoonfuls, though, her pace accelerated dramatically, with little breaks in between to suck any possible vestiges of flavor off of the spoon. Finding no more of the chocolate flakes in the bowl, Susan slurped the milk down into her growing gullet. Even the milk tasted a thousand times better than any other milk Susan had drank before!

She proceeded to the omelette and hashbrowns. Susan took to tearing off a piece of omelette and wrapping it around some hashbrowns to increase her eating efficiency. While not usually a fan of a salty breakfast, Susan could have eaten those omelettes and hashbrowns all day, and would have, too, if not for the other undevoured parts of her breakfast (in addition to her duties and responsibilities as a scientist, a superheroine, and a mother).

The waffles were Susan's biggest challenge (literally). Divided into two stacks of five, they were five inches in diameter and five inches in height, being drenched in butter and syrup and topped with whipped cream. Grabbing a knife and fork, Susan cut and ate them piece-by-divine-piece, sips from her shake interspersing. It took her 10 minutes to get through the waffles, and by the time she was finished with them, she was feeling rather full. Her belly was quite bloated, her previously baggy T-shirt now barely covering the entirety of the pudgy orb. Despite this, though, she still felt hungry. It was strange—she knew that she was full, and yet she continued to desire food as if she had yet to begin breakfast. Stroking her gut and shrugging, Susan moved on to the donuts.

There six kinds of donuts, two for each kind: chocolate long-johns, maple bars, classic, frosted, creme-filled, and chocolate-glazed with sprinkles. Susan started with the creme-filled, seeing as they usually were her least-favorite. That notion was almost instantaneously erased after the first bite. Susan actually leapt up to her feet in excitement, the flavor was so good. She stood there, leaning over the table, belly drooping, excitedly eating the donut, before grabbing the next one. This time, she dunked it in her shake before devouring it, but that did little more than whet her voracity. Down, down the donuts went into the Invisible Woman's stomach, kissing her taste buds with sensations that she would later describe as heavenly.

"Oof!" Susan groaned, collapsing back into her seat and massaging her engorged belly. There was no denying it, now—Susan Richards, AKA the Invisible Woman, was stuffed to the brim. Despite this fact, Susan found her appetite still unsatisfied. And while her stomach put up a good fight, in the end, appetite won, and Susan found herself reaching for the cake and the pie.

She grabbed one in each hand—pie in her left, cake in her right. Quick as lightning, the waiter dashed to Susan's table, placing a straw in her shake long enough to reach Susan, slumped in her chair with her belly bulging out.

"Thank you," she said before taking a large draft from her shake. The waiter bowed, then left Susan to her feasting.

She alternated between delicacies: left, right, middle; left, right, middle; pie, cake, shake; pie, cake, shake…

It was an attack on three fronts in the Battle of the Bulge, and it was clear on which side Susan had thrown her lot—the fat side, filled with a future of stuffing and puffing. The pie's dry, biting nature balanced with the cake's moist, chewy one. Combined with the shake, they made a trinity of ambrosia.

If there is a better way to finish a breakfast as marvelous as this, I don't know it, Susan raved, sliding the last of the pie and the cake into her mouth. Standing up gingerly, cheeks stuffed with cake and pie, Susan grabbed the cup containing her shake, stuck its bottom in the air, and took one final gulp. With a mighty belch, Susan finished her breakfast.

"Excuse me," she apologized, blushing.

No one seemed to pay her any heed, though—they all seemed to be busy eating there food. The odd thing was, though, that only the women seemed to be gorging themselves. The men were either eating at a normal pace or gawking at the voracity that their female companions were displaying.

Susan, for her part, paid no heed to the rest of the restaurant. The sheer amount of food had finally caught up to her, and all she could do was lie slumped in her seat, rubbing her belly soothingly.

"Ohhh…" she moaned.

She sat there for a few minutes before the Spider-Man waiter returned.

"Anything else today, Mrs. Richards?" he asked earnestly.

"No, I'm fine, really," she said, pausing to stifle a burp. "It was a wonderful breakfast, thank you."

"It was our pleasure. Anything we can do to make our superheroines and superheroes happy is reward enough for us," he said beamingly.

"That's very kind of you," Susan replied graciously.

"Do you need assistance returning home?" the waiter asked.

"No, it's fine," Susan answered. "I just need a few minutes."

"Well, in that case, thank you for coming to the Superheroes' Repast. Come again soon, and good luck!" And with that, the waiter left.

Susan lay there for another five minutes, stroking her belly. It had burgeoned out considerably, having to contain pounds of food waiting to be fully digested. Her T-shirt could no longer contain it, stopping just above her navel. Had Susan not unfastened them earlier, the buttons on her jeans would have surely popped. There was no way they were going to button around her globular gut anytime soon.

Susan smiled. Making a force-field, she slowly made her way back to the Baxter Building.

I'm going to be a fat woman, indeed.

1213122211.content:
"Amazing," the suited man said to his suited companion. "Just amazing."

The seated man smiled. "There's nothing quite like a superheroine getting fat of her own accord, is there?"

The two of them were watching Susan leave the Repast. Because of the nature of existence for the room, they were able to watch Susan as if they were right behind her without intruding on the other customers. Such were the laws of the dimension in which the room and the men existed.

"Indeed. Bu that was truly a sight to behold," the suited man said. "Her appetite, her voracity, her eating ability… it's amazing. Although I still miss the Susan from last week."

"She'll return soon enough," the seated man said. "In the meantime, we have three promising subjects well on their way to liberation."

"Should we check in on those two?"

"It has only been 30 minutes since last we saw Captain Marvel and Spider-Woman."

"I know, but they seemed to be ready to eat some more."

The seated man mulled it over, then shrugged. "I suppose it wouldn't hurt." Tapping a few buttons on the remote of his chair, the view on the wall changed. Where once was the doorway through which Susan Richards had left was now a live feed of Captain Marvel and Spider-Woman in the middle of a cake-eating contest.

"It seems that Spider-Woman is in the lead," the suited man said, smirking.

"Indeed it does. Although I wouldn't discount the Captain quite yet."

The two men observed the two Avengers for another few minutes, before Captain Marvel and Spider-Woman left the restaurant, cradling their bloated bellies awkwardly.

"There is no other sightvlike this, is there?"

"Indeed."
1213122211.title: The Benefactors.

choices: Reed questions Sue about her recent weight gain.
A surprise attack from the Negative Zone requires the attention of the FF!
12131222111.content:
"Oof!" Susan exclaimed, throwing herself back in her seat and massaging her swollen gut. The white fabric of her Unstable Molecule uniform seemed fit to burst after the brunch she just finished. Texan toast, an omelette, a box of donuts, and a whole chocolate cake only added to the already very large breakfast that she had devoured earlier today.

Two weeks ago, such a feat would have been unfeasible for Susan to accomplish. Now, however, after frequent stuffing sessions and numerous similar visits to the Superheroine's Repast, Susan was quite able.

Her plan to gain weight had been proceeding quite successfully. While she still sported a very large potbelly, the rest of her body had begun to catch up in fattening up along with it. Just two days ago, Susan had to restock her entire civilian wardrobe with new clothes, having outgrown the rest of her clothes a while ago. In total, Susan had put on 25 pounds in two weeks. After today, that number was sure to increase.

Getting up unsteadily, Susan began to make her way home. The Spider-Man waiter helped her up and ushered her to the door.

"Thank you," Susan said graciously. The Spider-Man waiter merely nodded in acknowledgment.

"Have a wonderful day," he said, before returning to her table and cleaning it up.

Susan made her way out the door and ran directly into another person. The two collapsed on the ground.

"Oh, dear," the other woman said, slowly picking herself up. "I'm so sorry—I didn't see you." The other woman got up and offered Susan a hand.

"No, no, it's alright. I should've been watching my step," Susan answered apologetically, gratefully taking the other woman's hand and standing back up.

A third woman in a Medusa costume stood beside the two women, and for a moment, all three stared at one another. Susan noted that the woman who had helped her up looked remarkably similar to her. The resemblance was almost uncanny. She was dressed in an old navy-and-white Fantastic Four uniform (the full bodysuit version, and not the regretfully revealing one), and looked almost like Susan herself had a few years ago when that was the standard uniform for the team. She was a bit softer, yes, not quite as slim and trim; but aside from that, she looked almost exactly like her.

"You both have wonderful costumes," Susan said, breaking the silence. The woman dressed as Medusa raised her hand as if to say something, but Susan's doppelgänger shook her head at her, cutting her off.

"Thank you. So do you. I love the design," she responded.

Susan nodded and smiled. "Excuse me," she said, and made her way back home.
12131222111.title: One week later, Susan...

choices: Susan and Wanda order seconds.
A few days later, Wanda is strangely absent for their lunchtime appointment.
121312221111.content:
"Um... Susan, dear?" Reed asked nervously.

Susan looked up from her book. "Yes, dear?"

Reed rubbed the back of his neck. "I was just... I mean... Ah... Are you feeling alright, dear?"

"Yes. Why do you ask?"

Reed stammered. "Well... it's just that--you seem--I mean--you--ah--"

"I've been putting on weight?"

Reed's face flushed. "Well--I mean--I wouldn't--"

"It's fine, dear. I know I've been putting on weight."

It had been a week or so since her encounter with the Susan and Medusa cosplayers, and in that time, Susan had managed to add fifteen pounds to her frame. She was becoming quite plump. Her legs were close to rubbing together when she walked; her arms were quite soft and flabby; her breasts had grown fuller; her hips, already a bit wide, were thicker; her derriere was quite larger; and, biggest of all, was her big, bulging, globular potbelly, which was now well on its way to outgrowing that title.

Reed breathed a sigh of relief. "Oh, thank goodness. That gets that out of the way. Any particular reason for it?"

"I'm trying out something new. And I must say, I'm liking it so far."

Reed shrugged. "I trust you. As long as you're happy, I'm happy."

"Thank you, Reed," Susan said gratefully. At that moment, her stomach grumbled. Susan stood up. "I'm going to go out for lunch. Let me know if anything happens, okay?"

"Of course."

Susan smiled. She gave Reed a quick peck on the cheek. "See you in a bit."

*****

Susan was about to enter the Superheroine's Repast when a gloved hand reached around her and opened the door. "Allow me," the owner of the hand said.

Susan turned around.

Holding the door for her was none other than the Uncanny Avenger known as the Scarlet Witch, better known to Susan by her given name of Wanda Maximoff.

"Thank you, Wanda," Susan said gratefully before entering.

Wanda gasped. "Wait, Susan? Is that really you?"

Susan smiled. "In the flesh."

Wanda stammered. "You look--you look--"

"Fatter? I'm trying something new."

Wanda entered the restaurant. "... I see. Well, it is your choice. And it looks good on you.

"Thank you," Susan replied gratefully. "Would you care to have lunch with me?"

At that moment, Wanda's stomach growled. "I was just about to ask you the same thing," she said. "This is a delightful little eatery. I've been coming here for a few days, now."

Susan nodded in agreement. The two superheroines proceeded to a table. Susan noticed that there was something different about the Scarlet Witch. She seemed... fuller, for lack of a better term. The fabric of her coat dress seemed a bit more strained around the midriff, and Susan could have sworn that she saw Wanda's belly jiggle ever so slightly behind the fabric of her costume.

Guess I'm not the only one who's packed on some pounds... Susan mused to herself.

Wanda and Susan sat down at the table. Immediately, they were greeted by the Spider-Man waiter.

"Ah! Wonderful to see you two again. The usual, Mrs. Invisible Woman?"

Susan nodded.

"Excellent! And for you, Ms. Scarlet Witch?"

Wanda turned to Susan. "Would you mind if I shared with you? Just to get a taste for the food."

"Sure," Susan answered.

"Then I'll have a chocolate cake, please," Wanda told the Spider-Man waiter.

"Alright! Your food will be here shortly." And with that, the Spider-Man waiter hurried off.

"I have to warn you, Wanda—I eat a lot," Susan said, patting her belly. "You might not be able to handle it all."

"Actually, I'm just hoping I can control myself. Every time I've been here, I've eaten far more than I normally do. It's… starting to show, I think," Wanda sad sheepishly, eyeing her own softening stomach.

Susan smiled. "Oh, don't worry about it. You wear it well. Besides, you're a superhero. You can burn it off quickly enough if you don't like it."

"… I suppose your right," Wanda said.

"And, hey, I come here often enough. If you want, you can meet me at the Baxter Building and we can have lunch together."

Wanda was a bit taken aback. Not many people extended a hand in friendship to her. But upon seeing the sincerity in Susan's face, Wanda smiled. "That sounds like fun."

The Spider-Man waiter arrived with the food. "Two orders of fried chicken, ten double hamburgers, and fries for the Invisible Woman," he said, placing the meal on the table, "and a chocolate cake for the Scarlet Witch." He stood still and clasped his hands together. "Enjoy, ladies!" And with that, he left.

"Well… bon appetit," said Susan. Wanda dipped her head in grace, and the two dug in.

The chicken was the first to go. Susan let Wanda take what she wanted, then took the rest for herself. Susan, while plumper than she had been, was not quite plump enough. At least, not yet. Susan quickly gobbled down one whole order of fried chicken. Wanda, for her part, managed to eat three-fourths of one, eating a few fries in between. Susan noted that Wanda didn't even look at the burgers. Unbeknownst to Susan, Wanda didn't eat beef, mostly because she had been delivered into this world by a cow-person from the High Evolutionary's home at Mount Wundagore.

The burgers were thick, juicy, and filling. Luckily, Susan had a lot more room to fill. The first three burgers were followed by the next three. By this point, Susan was starting to feel full. A few days ago, she had felt stuffed at this point. But now, due in part to sharing with Wanda, (but mostly to her larger stomach capacity,) Susan didn't feel quite as full. She still had plenty of room for the remaining nine burgers (although her belly started expanding at round the eleventh burger). Finishing off the last of the chicken, Susan pushed back her seat, content with her meal.

Wanda, meanwhile, was in the middle of a frenzy. While the food at the Repast had been quite exquisite, the cake was almost intoxicating. Truth be told, the soft layer of pudge accumulating on her figure mostly came from eating similar cakes at the Repast. Wanda ate with abandon, shovelling spoonful after ambrosial spoonful of chocolate cake into her mouth and down into her ever-growing gullet. Finishing up a few minutes after Susan, Wanda kicked back in her chair, cradling her orb-like food baby.

"You look like you had fun," Susan commented.

Wanda moaned. "I lost control again, didn't I?"

"Little bit. But can you really say it wasn't worth it?"

Wanda stifled a burp. "... No."

Susan smiled. "That's what I thought."
121312221111.title: Reed questions Sue about her recent weight gain.

choices: Susan and Wanda go for thirds.
The next day, Reed has something world-shattering he needs to tell Susan.
1213122211112.content:
"Where is she?" Susan asked herself, staring at the clock and tapping her foot impatiently.

It was almost lunchtime, and Wanda was running late for their appointment at the Superheroine's Repast, which was quite unlike her. True, Wanda wasn't a frequent visitor of the Baxter Building up until recently, but being 20 minutes late? That was ridiculous.

Susan's stomach rumbled hungrily. She patted her belly and made up her mind. I'll leave a note for her, she thought, quickly grabbing a pad and paper and scribbling a short message on it. She taped it to her front door and headed out to the Superheroine's Repast.

Susan entered the restaurant and walked to the counter. She was about to ask the Spider-Man waiter for a seat when she heard a familiar voice calling her name. Susan turned around to the source.

"Oh, Wanda! I was wondering where you had gotten off to."

Wanda sat at a food-laden table with two other women dressed as superheroines. One of them, a pudgy blonde woman dressed like the Invisible Woman, took one look at Susan and momentarily became distressed, whispering something incoherently. Her friend, a tall redheaded woman with a small layer of fat dressed up as Medusa, looked at her friend questioningly. Both women looked familiar, but Susan couldn't quite place where she had met them before.

The blonde woman looked up at Susan. "Well... Since you two know each other... Would you care to join us?" she asked.

Susan tilted her head, and finally recognized Wanda's companions. "Aren't you the woman I ran into the other week?"

"I believe I am. Would you like some fries?" the blonde woman asked, offering Susan a box.

Susan glanced at the food and remembered how hungry she was. "I would love to," she said. Susan walked towards the table and sat down.

The blonde woman smiled. She passed the fries over to Susan, who gladly took them and immediately started nibbling on them.

"Y'know," Susan began, "we might have to order more food. This might not be enough for all of us." She patted her belly for emphasis. "It takes a lot for me to be satisfied."

"Not to worry," said Wanda, "you can share with me. I probably won't eat that much."

"Fantastic," Susan giggled.

And without further ado, the women dug in.

*****

"Ooh..." moaned the redheaded woman in the Medusa costume. "I... I believe that's quite enough for me today," she said, slowly making an effort to get up.

"Me, too," said her companion as she followed suit. "It was lovely meeting all of you." Pushing in their chairs, the two women left, returning unsteadily to what was presumably their home.

Susan and Wanda remained seated, massaging their swollen stomachs. Both of them had devoured not one, but TWO courses of a meal that could very well have fed nine people. Wanda had displayed a surprising voracity, probably having eaten the most out of the four women.

"Those two were lovely people," Susan said, making small-talk. "And their costumes were amazing."

Wanda looked over at Susan. "Oh, those weren't costumes. They were the Invisible Woman and Medusa."

Susan showed her head towards Wanda. "Wait, what?"

"They're from an alternate universe. Somehow, I ended up at their Baxter Building this morning. That's why I was late."

"And you didn't think to... question this?"

"Honestly? I was really more concerned about getting some lunch," Wanda admitted, smiling softly.
1213122211112.title: A few days later, Wanda is strangely absent for...

choices: The next day.
One week later.
12131222111122.content:
"Susan, dear?" Susan felt Reed gently waking her. "Something happened. Can you come with me to the lab?"

An icy dread descended down Susan's spine. Whenever Reed had "something happen" at this hour, it usually meant nothing good. Slowly, Susan rose up from bed.

"What's wrong?" she asked.

Reed's face was grim. He brought out his right hand. A red holographic image of the Earth with a countdown projected forth from his palm. "I think the world might be ending soon."

Susan's stomach dropped. "I... I don't understand..."

"I can explain it in the lab."

***

"Everything dies. You, me, everyone on this planet. Our sun, our galaxy, and, eventually, our universe. It's inevitable. And I accept it." Reed was solemn. "Or at least... I thought I did." Typing at his computer, Reed opened up a projection of two Earth, separated by a dimensional barrier. The two Earths began moving towards each other, culminating in the destruction of both Earths after they collided. "In another part of the Multiverse, two alternate Earths broke the dimensional barrier separating their universes and collided together in an event called an incursion. The result was the total annihilation of both Earths' individual universes.

"Since then, these incursions have grown alarmingly frequent. Our once infinite Multiverse has now been reduced down to a couple dozen universes. To try to solve this problem, T'Challa reformed the Illuminati. We've been dealing with these incursions as best we can, but it hasn't been enough. Our world will soon collide with another."

Susan was. "The entire Multiverse..."

Reed nodded grimly. "I'm sorry, my love. I couldn't save our family."

Susan took a step back. The end of everything was upon them and, for the first time ever, the FF couldn't stop it.

"How much time do we have left?"

"Two hours."

The two were silent for what seemed like a century. Susan gently made her way over to her husband. Silently, the two embraced.

"You really have put in quite a deal of weight," Reed teased gently.

Susan smiled softly. "I really like it."

"I do, too."

Susan sighed. "Can we just... Stay here? Until the end?"

Reed nodded. "There's nothing else we can do. I began designing a life raft, but it won't be finished in time."

"You did your best."

"... Susan. I don't say this often enough, but... I love you. Until the end of time."

"I know. I love you, too."

And with that, everything died.

***

Or at least, it almost did.
12131222111122.title: The next day, Reed has something world-shatter...

choices: The next day, Susan and Wanda sign up for a superheroine eating contest.
A few days later, Susan meets a non-powered doppelgänger at the Repast.
121312221111222.content:
Wanda burped richly, having just finished an entire box of donuts by herself. She patted her taut belly, moaning slightly.

"Excuse me," she apologized to Susan.

Susan chuckled. "You seem to be enjoying yourself," she said.

Wanda nodded. "These donuts are absolutely DIVINE. I've been eating them almost every day since this new world was formed."

"It certainly seems like you have," Susan teased, eyeing Wanda's softer figure.

Wanda cocked an eyebrow. "And I suppose you're one to talk about keeping your figure trim?" she said in amused sarcasm.

"I'm just saying, it seems like I'm not the only one who's been getting a bit round in the middle," Susan replied, pinching some of her belly fat for emphasis.

Susan had no idea how the incursion had been averted, or why the Beyonders had merged various Earths together into a new patchwork planet, but she decided not to concern herself with it. The crisis had been averted, and if another one was coming, then they would have time to prepare for it. N the meantime, Susan could focus on her new goal: gaining weight and getting fat.

Over the course of the past week, Susan had managed to put on an additional 10 pounds. The rest of her body had finally fattened up normally, but Susan's belly was still her largest feature. And, frankly, she didn't mind. She loved it in all of its orb-like softness.

Wanda, for her part, had also gained a noticeable amount of weight. Not as much as Susan had, but enough to widen her hips, thicken her waist, and plumpen her belly.

"I can't say I mind, though," Wanda said contemplatively. She gave her belly a pat. "I love this food, and I don't really care about the extra weight."

"It looks good on you," Susan said.

"Thank you. That means a lot," Wanda beamed.

"So," Susan said, "ready for dessert?"
121312221111222.title: One week later.

choices: A few months later, Susan's getting chubby.
A few weeks later, Susan has a pot belly.
122.content:
Victor Von Doom observed the monitor as his nanobot served it's purpose, injecting Susan Storm with a certain formula he had developed. It was quite ingenious, if he did say so himself. The formula caused the victim to gain weight but slowly, so as not to alarm the victim. Every piece of food that they ate would be turned into fat and show up on the body. Once the victim had reached over two hundred pounds they would start to sweat, the stench of which would infect any who smelt the body odor with the formula.

Doom's plot had originated when he had last had them at his castle and Susan had refused to partake from his table, citing a diet. Whether mere levity or truth, it wouldn't matter as Susan would soon be fat enough to make a mutant like Blob look anorexic.

"It's only a matter of time and I am a patient man," Doom's voice boomed.

Susan flinched as she felt a mosquito bite her, the Invisible Woman swiftly slapping the offending insect.

She then started the movie she had picked out for her and Reed's "No Lab Work" time, something Susan had had to implement after Reed spent three whole days sequestered in his lab.

Reed entered the living room then, carrying an immense bowl of popcorn laden with butter. Smiling at her husband, they snuggled together as the movie started, Susan taking a bite of the snack and enjoying the salt and butter sliding down her throat.
122.title: An evil plot is hatched targeting Susan!

choices: Follow Susan and Crystal.
Follow Medusa
Follow She Hulk
123.content:
"BURRRRRRPPPP! Oops... excuse me." Susan Richards also known as the Invisible Woman blushed as she covered her mouth just a bit too late. Her three dinning companions, Jennifer Walters also known as She Hulk and the Inhuman sisters Crystal and Medusa all giggled at Susan's breach of etiquette. Once they stopped Crystal laid a hand o Susan's shoulder. "It's all right Sue, we'll just pretend you were invisible and that someone behind you belched."

The four were gathered for the grand opening of a new restaurant the Superheroines' Repast, which had a most unique feature. Anyone who ate there dressed as a superheroine got a 20% off their bill, and any actual superheroine could eat as much as they wanted for free.

Subsequently Susan had gathered up some of her friends and they'd headed over to find out if the offer really was true. It had proven so and a short while later they'd helped themselves to a little of everything, and then a lot of some things.

Medusa patted her now somewhat more well padded purple outfit with both hands. "Oh that chocolate cake was simply to die for..." Jennifer Walters nodded, her purple and white outfit normally showed of her considerable abdominal muscles, but a layer of flab had spread over them a the moment. "And those Belgian waffles..." Crystal rubbed her own tummy which was currently covered by her electric yellow outfit. "And the pudding..." Susan couldn't help but nod. "I know, normally I eat like a bird, but everything here was just so good I felt like I couldn't help myself..."

A few strands of Medusa's red hair reached out and felt up Susan's currently squishy belly. "You keep coming here Sue and you won't be able to help purchasing clothes at a larger size."

Susan blushed again and then pushed away Medusa's hairs with an invisible forcefield. "It'll only be a once a month thing, that way I've got plenty of time to work off any pounds I put on, superheroing is hard work after all."

The four slowly stood up pushed in their chairs and began to walk towards the door, though they moved somewhat disjointedly due to the effect of being practically stuffed full to bursting with food. She Hulk looked fondly back at the building as they took their first few steps out into daylight, her emerald and hair glistening as the sunlight fell upon it. "I don't know who runs that place, but I'm going to have to find out and send them a thank you letter, a meal there would really hit the spot as a way of celebrating after saving the world!" The other three superheroines nodded, and Medusa gave Crystal a quick proxy hug with her hair. "Good luck sister..."

Then an opaque portal created by the Inhuman Lockjaw opened before the red haired queen and she stepped through it. Susan of course knew what she was talking about, Crystal and her brother's on again off again romance was on again. The Invisible Woman hopped it would work this time, life was a lot easier when she didn't have to deal with her brother mopping around. "So Crys, race you back to headquarters?" Crystal grabbed her slightly sagging gullet and looked at Susan like she was insane. "Sue, you should know better than to use your superpowers thirty minutes after you've eaten..." All three broke up into more uproarious laughter at the orange haired Inhuman's joke.
123.title: Susan was out dineing with a few of her fellow ...

choices: Susan goes to talk to Reed in the lab, gets a snack after getting upset at him
Crystal gets a little bored and hungry while Johnny play his game, gets a snack
Ben and Alicia return with Pizza, both Susan and Crystal have some
1231.content:
Susan and Crystal said good bye to Jennifer and Medusa and hailed a cab. With both girls being very attractive, even in their stuffed state that caused their bellies to be a little bloated, a cab stopped quickly for them, they got in, and got a ride back to the Baxter Building. They then rode the elevator up to their floor and got off.

Predicatably Reed, Susan's husband was in the lab working on yet his latest gaget while Johnny was playing a video game. Ben Grimm was out with his girlfriend Alicia. "Hey Johnny" the girls greeted the younger Storm. Susan couldn't help but smirk seeing Johnny immediately put his game on pause and jumped up to greet them. It always amused her that Crystal could always get Johnny to do anything that she couldn't. It was nice for her to finally have a way to get her hot-headed and sometimes irresponsible little brother to do what she needed him to do for a change. She understand that because she was his sister, he was less likely to listen to her, but since Crystal was his girlfriend, he would listen to her more. She also could tell that Johnny listened to Crystal because he really liked her. For the first time she had seen her little brother in love and was happy for him. She really hoped that it would work out between them this time.

"Have a nice lunch with Jennifer and Medusa?" Johnny asked, causing Susan to snap out of her thoughts. "It was nice. They weren't kidding about superheriones getting a free meal" Susan replied with a soft laugh, self conciously passing her a bit bloated belly, hoping that Johnny didn't notice. "I also had a nice time as well. It's always good to see my sister" Crystal replied. Noticing the game that Johnny had on pause, Crystal shook her and laughed. "Okay, what game are you playing now?"

"C'mon on, I will show you" Johnny said grabbing Crystal's hand and leading her over to the tv. Crystal sat down next to Johnny and began to listin to Johnny explain the game before watching him start playing it. Crystal really is a good match for him Susan thought to herself. She then headed into the lab to find her husband.
1231.title: Follow Susan and Crystal.

choices: Two slices of pizza later Susan feels even hungrier!
Something else!
12311.content:
The closer and closer Susan got to the lab however, the less and less she realized that she wanted to be there. She’d ventured in on her husband when he was in the middle of one of his pet project’s countless times before and the result was always the same. She knew that her husband loved her but Reed Richards could be incredibly single minded about his work, and trying to get him to pull himself awa from it was a more or less hopeless task.

So rather than bothering with getting bogged down in a conversation she’d had countless times before Susan turned around and decided to spare herself that particular migraine. As she did so however the Invisible Woman felt her stomach rumble. Susan looked down at her belly and poked it wearily. It was hard for her to believe that it was acting like this.

Back in the Superheroine’s Repast she had stuffed herself to the point that she’d felt like bursting and hadn’t been quite sure if she’d be able to walk home under her own power, or even float there with an invisible forcefield holding her up. Yet now, less than half an hour after she had eaten that monstrous meal she was already starting to feel hungry again!

Shaking her head to clear away such thoughts of confusion Susan made her way to one of the Baxter Building’s many kitchens. If there was one thing she had learned during her two pregnancies it was that when a woman’s body wanted something, it was folly for that woman to try and stand in the way. So rather than waste time contemplating how unusual a shift this was in her appetite, instead Susan got to work cooking.

The Baxter Building was of course unsurpisingly quite well stocked for food (in case something unfortunate should happen to it as a result of one of her husband’s experiments or some supervillians actions thus leaving them cut off from civilization for a while) and Susan decided that she’d cook herself up a nice large pizza. She’d should only need to eat a slice or two to ward off these hunger pangs and then she’d head to her room and grab a nice afternoon nap to sleep off her large meal and after meal snack so as to give the food plenty of time to digest, yeah that was the ticket!
12311.title: Susan gets a snack...

choices: Susan wakes up a few hours later
Susan is woken up later by Reed
123111.content:
Susan walked over to the oven, turned it on, and began to wait for it to hit up. As the oven heated up, she walked over to the freezer, pulled out the pizza, and began to let it thaw. She then walked back to the fridge, and pulled out a mountin dew code red soda. She opened it and took a couple sips before setting it down on the table. After a couple of minutes, the oven was ready and the pizza had thawed enough for her to put it in. She slide in the pizza, shut the door, and then set the time. As she waited for the pizza to cook, she headed back into the living room to grab a gossip magazine to read as she waited. She smiled to herself seeing Johnny still playing the game with Crystal watching him. She then grabbed her magazine and headed back into the kitchen.

She sat down at the table and drank some more of her soda she flipped through her magazines. After about 20 minues, the timer went off, she got up, and went over to check on the pizza. it was finished, she put on some gloves, and pulled it out. She let it cool for a bit before grabbing a plate and putting two slices on her plate. She then carried the plate back over to the table and took a seat. The pizza looked and smelled so good that she immediately began to eat it as she resumed reading her magazine. She continued to take bite after bite of the first slice until she finished it off. She licked some of the grease off her hands before realizing what she was doing and quickly wiped her hands off with a napkin. She was glad that none of the guys nor her children saw her doing that since she would never leave it done after always being on their case for their table manners. She washed the slice down with a couple more sips of her soda.

Before she even realized it, Susan picked up the next slice of pizza, and before long she had finished it off as well. It was so tasty that she couldn't stop eating it. Once again she licked some of the grease off her fingers before wiping her hands off with another napkin. She then washed it down with a couple sips of her soda. Expecting to feel really full, she was surprised to realize that she felt even hungrier then before. She blushed a little as she heard her stomach growl. She glanced over at the rest of the table and licked her lips. It smelled so good and tasted so good. Having another slice wouldn't hurt right she thought to herself. Feeling a little lazy she used her powers to move the rest of the pizza over to the table.

After setting it down in front of her, Susan helped herself to another slice. Finishing it off quicker then the first two, she helped herself to another, and then another. The pizza was so good and she was still so hungry that she couldn't stop eating it. It wasn't too long before she had finished off the rest of the large pizza which had been a total of eight slices. She licked the grease off her fingers one last time before wiping her hands with a new napkin and then washing it down with the rest of her soda. She blushed when she let out a girly little burp. She was once again glad that neither the guys nor her children were around to hear it.

She then laid back in her stomach, moaning softly. She felt so incredibly stuffed. She could feel her stomach groaning and churning, trying to digest all that food she had just consumed in this rather short amount of time. Her bloated belly was pushing out through her top even more than before. She was so stuffed that it was a little painful but it was a pleasurable painful. She had to admit that she was enjoying being this stuffed. All that food had made her very tired so she couldn't really think too much more about that then that. After a couple of minutes, she slowly got up, threw away the empty soda bottle after rinising it out, and cleaned off the plate and pan.

Susan then slowly made her way back into the bedroom she shared with Reed. She kicked off her pink flip flops, sat down on her bed, and laid down on her bed. 123111221111.content:
The skies were red. The kind of red that the universe uses to imply that something major was going to happen. Something that could change the very nature of the cosmos itself.

In the Baxter Building, Crystal, Susan, and the rest of the Fantastic Four slept peacefully in their beds.

Across town, at a nexus point between various similar but separate worlds, was a restaurant. Susan and Crystal were quite familiar with it—it was the reason their dreams were filled with such rich and fattening foods. It was the Superheroine's Repast. And it had visitors.

These were not customers looking for a chance to dine. They were not even of this world. They were the Illuminati, and they sought to save all of existence from an event known as an incursion.

Black Bolt, King of the Inhumans; Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme; Reed Richards, Mr. Fantastic; Hank Pym, the Ant-Man; T'Challa, the Black Panther; Hank McCoy, the Beast; Anthony Stark, Iron Man; Namor, King of Atlantis; and Susan Storm-Richards, the Invisible Woman.

This Susan was plumper than the one sleeping peacefully on the other side of the city. Her figure was the result of frequent trips to this very same restaurant.

"How much time do we have until the incursion?" Susan asked her cohorts.

Black Bolt held out his hand. A holographic projection of the Earth with a countdown clock activated.

"Ten minutes," said Black Panther, speaking for the mute Black Bolt.

"Hank—did you finish that Pym Particle Bomb?" Susan asked the diminutive hero.

Ant-Man grew back to regular size and shook his head sadly. "I'd need at least another day. All of the other prototypes were too unstable. We might end up shrinking one of the Earths down infinitely into the Microverse."

Susan pinched the bridge of her nose. "You did what you could." Taking a deep breath, she turned to Iron Man. "Tony—"

But the Armored Avenger shook his head. "We can't do it, Sue. A dead world's one thing. But blowing up another Earth line ours? It's too much."

Namor rolled his eyes. "We don't have any other options, Stark," he snarled. "We either let our world get destroyed, or we destroy another."

"We're supposed to be heroes!" Tony retorted. "This isn't right!"

Namor looked like he was about to attack Tony, but Susan raised her hand, stopping the fight from escalating. She walked over to Tony.

"Are you sure about this, Tony?" she asked.

"... No. But it's the right thing to do."

Susan nodded. She walked to her husband. "Any ideas, brainiac?" she asked, teasing him melancholically.

Reed smiled sadly. "I'm afraid I've failed you, my dear," he said.

The two embraced.

"Oh, for GOD'S SAKE!" Namor yelled. He leapt at Iron Man and swiftly ripped off one of his gauntlets. "If none of you are willing to save the world," he said, activating a detonator for a world-destroying missile on Tony's gauntlet, "I--

There was a flash of light in the restaurant. Namor dropped the gauntlet. The Illuminati looked up, and the sight before them was almost incomprehensible. Two beings existing in our plane of reality in a way that should have been impossible.

We are from Beyond. We are dreamers. We are destroyers. But we were promised these worlds. They are ours to do with as we see fit. And for now, they are safe. This shall not be a game of survival. It shall be one of convergence. From two, there shall be one.

The Illuminati made not a move as the Beyonders made their proclamation. Surely, they would have perished before their might if they chose to fight. But before they were the Illuminati, they were Avengers—and they would fight for the sake of all worlds until the end.

But the Illuminati knew that this was not the end. So they listened.

We have foreseen the death of our kind. The defeat that lies in wait for them in the line of infinity. Their Doom is not one which we wish to share. We are young, and they heeded us not. So we took our worlds, and we shall save them from oblivion, until the time comes for the multiverse to be restored.

And so it was that many worlds became one.

And the Illuminati watched.

“All right then where should we meet up? I just got in from running a few miles so I’m a little bushed, but I could probably jog on over to the Baxter Building in about half an hour without much in the way of difficulty...”

The men have all stopped looking at her by now, she thinks, sitting in the food court among other invisible people, spooning the yogurt into her mouth. Its pink contrasts with the pink of her tongue, and she holds it there, savoring it. One of the few pleasures left me, she thinks, and swallows. The yogurt passes down her throat, becoming tasteless as it was before. It was only for that moment, when it lingered in her mouth, that it was, in a sense, real. She swallows another bite. She has grown tired of feeling real.

The other pleasures--if longer-lasting--were more transitory than this, for they came to an end, and she can still always eat. They could pluck out her eyes, stop her ears, do everything but kill her, and she would be able to gorge herself still on yogurt or ice cream or chips or whatever. The pleasure of sex was gone--her young, lithe body naked against Reed's, his advances timid, at first, but soon warming up as they found a rhythm that was completely their own. This was cut short, of course. The pleasure of friendship, also, was gone--the late nights laughing and joking with her brother and Ben, who loved her--who possibly even still would have loved her this way. No way to tell, though. Fighting alongside all three of them, for good or the universe or America, or whatever they thought they held dear, when what they all really held dear was the bond--that fantastic bond--by which they all shaped one another. And slowly, as the other three disappeared into public and private memory, she had also lost her looks. It seemed at first poor compensation, this over-eating, for the world of pleasure she was grieving. But it insulated her, it made her feel safe--and paradoxically, in control. Every day, in the mirror, she watched her body expand to fill the void left by the other three men--brother, friend and lover.

"Are you sure you don't want to come with us?" Reed asked Susan.

"Oh, please, I don't even like Star Trek. You don't want me there," Susan answered.

"Well... You just got back... And..." Reed stammered.

"And we can spend some time together when you get back," Susan purred, winking slyly. "Go. Have fun with the boys. I'll be here."

"Well..."

"Hey, Stretch! All aboard the Nerdy Express!" bellowed Ben Grimm, the ever-lovin', blue-eyed Thing from the pilot seat of the Fantasticar. Behind him was Johnny Storm, AKA the Human Torch, who was busy texting.

"Go," Susan reassured Reed, smiling.

Reed nodded, and, after a quick kiss, stretched into his seat in the Fantasticar. Waving goodbye, Reed, Johnny, and Ben rocketed off into the New York skyline. The cineplex was having a Star Trek marathon, and the boys decided to head out.

Susan turned around to face Medusa, who was standing quietly behind her. The two were dressed in casual outfits—Susan in sweatpants and a T-shirt, and Medusa in jeans and a tank top. "Well," Susan began, patting her belly, "I don't know about you, but I am FAMISHED."

Medusa's stomach growled loudly. "It seems as though you are not the only one."

Susan giggled. "C'mon. Let's go get something to eat."

*****

An hour later, Susan and Medusa were lounging in the dining room of the Baxter Building. Each of them had an Extra-Large cheese pizza ordered from a nearby pizzeria and each of them was halfway done with theirs. Medusa had no idea why, but she had been unable to control her appetite all day. She just had to eat, and it just wasn't satisfying unless she was stuffed to the brim. Even after her unbelievably large lunch at the Superheroine's Repast earlier that day, Medusa still felt like she could eat a whole pizza.

Which was exactly what she was doing. Eating without cutlery was a strange experience for her, but she found that pizza was, in fact, a very delectable meal, especially hot. It filled her throat and stomach with warmth satisfyingly.

Medusa and Susan kicked back in their chairs simultaneously, having managed to finish up at the same time. After a few minutes, Susan smiled deviously.

"Ready for dessert?" she asked.

Any other day, Medusa would have called Susan crazy. Today, however, Medusa merely used her to open up the freezer and pull out two quarts of ice cream. "Shall we?" she asked, giving one of the containers to Susan.

"Yes."

And with that, the two of them began stuffing themselves with ice cream. Medusa's stomach cried out to stop, having reached its full capacity three slices ago. Her appetite, however, commanded her to eat, and eat she did, spoonful after spoonful of ice cream delicately entering her mouth and down into her gullet. Halfway through the carton, the button of her jeans burst off with an audible pop, clattering onto the floor.

"Now, see, this is why I wore sweats," Susan said, stretching the waistband of her sweatpants out in front of her. "More room to grow."

Medusa blushed. "I shall keep that in mind," she said.

Susan smiled sweetly, and then proceeded with stuffing herself silly with ice cream. Medusa joined in. Occasionally, however, her eyes darted to her own growing belly. How much larger am I going to get?

Medusa's inspections did not escape Susan's notice. "Fighting in the battle of the bulge, huh?"

Medusa looked up at Susan. "I'm afraid that I am unfamiliar with that colloquialism."

Susan smiled. "Look—you're a superhero. You'll work it off quickly enough. And if you don't, well, then, you make it work. It's not all bad having a little extra pudge," Susan said, grabbing some of her newfound belly fat and shaking it. "It's kinda fun, actually. And I don't feel so guilty anymore about eating the last slice of pie."

Medusa nodded. "I am still not sure..."

"Hey, if it doesn't make you happy, you can change it. But, honestly, I know I put on a few, and I feel better than I have in a long time."

Medusa mused silently to herself. Then, she picked up her spoon and continued eating. "I suppose a little indulgence won't be too terrible," she stated.

Susan grinned. "You said it, sister."

Medusa's eyes fluttered open. Yawning, she sat up in her bed, stretching the tiredness out of her arms. She wore a navy nightgown, having changed out of her costume before going to bed. Unstable molecules had many uses, but Medusa felt uncomfortable sleeping in a skintight outfit. Medusa got out of bed, working the kinks out of her neck. *****

Medusa found Susan upstairs stuffing herself silly with a large breakfast. Susan looked up at Medusa and smiled. "Good morning, Medusa! Want some waffles?"

Medusa's stomach growled quietly in hunger. The Inhuman Queen, however, ignored it. "No," she denied firmly.

Susan's smile faltered. "Are you sure? They're really good."

Medusa remained adamant. "No," she restated, her hair pushing Susan's breakfast off to the side. "No more distractions. No more misdirections. No more avoiding the questions. It's time for answers. What is going on, Susan? What do you know about the doppelgängers?"

Susan's smile slowly faded away. She hung her head in defeat and sighed. She was silent for a moment.

"Everything dies," Susan began quietly. "You, me, everyone on this planet. Our sun, our galaxy, and, eventually, our universe. It's inevitable." Susan looked up at Medusa. Her eyes were sad. "That's what my husband told me right before he explained that the multiverse was collapsing."

Medusa's stomach dropped. "... The multiverse... Is--"

Susan nodded. "It started a while ago. Two Earths from parallel realities collided together in an event known as an incursion. The universes of both Earths were destroyed. Since then, numerous incursions have taken place. Sometimes, only one of the realities is destroyed, the other one being spared. But most times, it's complete destruction of both universes."

"... But... How does Reed Richards know this? How do you know it?" Medusa asked incredulously.

Susan sighed. "After the Kree-Skrull War, Tony Stark thought it would be a good idea to bring together a group of superheroes to share information about events like these. Reed and I were among the chosen. Black Bolt was, too." Medusa's eyes widened at the sound of her husband's name. Susan straightened up in her seat. "Namor summoned us together after he saw an incursion be prevented by a being known as a Black Swan. She destroyed another Earth that was about to impact our own. She escaped before Namor could grab her, but not before he was able to gather enough information to figure out what was going on."

Medusa staggered back. Susan used a force-field to pull up a chair for the Inhuman Queen to fall into. "Is there any way to stop these incursions?"

Susan's face became grim. "None that are acceptable. Yet. That's why I left. I went to find a way to stop them."

"Did you?"

Susan pinched the bridge of her nose, resting her elbow on the table. "No."

"... So... These doppelgängers--"

"Are showing up because the fabric of space and time are weakening in our universe and another universe. Or at least, that's what I think is happening." Susan lifted her head up. "Does that answer your question?"

Medusa thought for a minute. "There's one thing I don't understand." Susan tilted her head in curiosity. "How does the Superheroine's Repast fit into all of this?"

Susan smiled. "I think they're our only hope of a better solution."

Medusa felt a hand softly caress her cheek. She slowly opened her eyes, and the sight that greeted them was not a void bereft of life or whatever lay beyond death. It was her husband, sitting by her bed in her room in the Baxter Building.

"Blackagar..." she whispered.

Black Bolt smiled. Medusa sat up in her bed, and for a moment, the two spouses just looked at one another, taking comfort in the existence of the other. Black Bolt leaned his head into that of his Queen, a gesture she reciprocated, and the world around them faded away in a flash of light.

*****

The mindscape shared by Black Bolt and Medusa was a small comfort. Here, Black Bolt could speak without fear of destroying everything around him, and Medusa could enjoy the company of her husband. For them, it was a safe place.

Beneath the golden skies and the vermilion trees stood Medusa in garment of snakeskin and the Midnight King with radiant eyes.

"Your time with the Fantastic Four has treated you well, my love," Black Bolt teased, smiling in amusement.

Medusa looked down at herself. Even here, her weight gain was evident. "Yes, it has," she said, blushing.

"And yet, you are as fair and noble as ever," Black Bolt said, embracing his wife.

Medusa smiled. "Flattery does not befit you, my king."

"Perhaps. But the brevity of time can show a husband all of the possible ways he could have been better to his wife."

Medusa took Black Bolt's hand, stroking it gently. "What happened, my love? What of the incursion?"

Black Bolt was silent. "You... Know of the incursions?"

"The signs were there. Particularly around this one restaurant. 'The Superheroine's Repast.' Susan believed it was the key to saving everything."

Medusa felt Black Bolt nod. "Mm..."

"But the incursion was supposed to have happened at midnight. What happened?"

Silence.

"... Everything was about to die. We all stood and watched it happen. Anthony Stark had created a weapon capable of destroying a world, but no one would dare use it. And just as we were about to..."

*****

Black Bolt stood amongst the Illuminati. Surrounding him was Doctor Strange, Sorcerer Supreme; Reed Richards, Mr. Fantastic; Hank Pym, the Ant-Man; T'Challa, the Black Panther; Hank McCoy, the Beast; Anthony Stark, Iron Man; Namor, King of Atlantis; and Susan Storm-Richards, the Invisible Woman. And the sight before them was almost incomprehensible. Two beings existing in our plane of reality in a way that should have been impossible.

We are from Beyond. We are dreamers. We are destroyers. But we were promised these worlds. They are ours to do with as we see fit. And for now, they are safe. This shall not be a game of survival. It shall be one of convergence. From two, there shall be one.

Black Bolt watched as the beings made their proclamation. If he spoke, mountains would shatter. And though it would not do much to the Beyonders, it would be a final act of resistance before the end. An end worthy of a king.

But Black Bolt spoke not. For he sensed that the end was not near. The Beyonders spoke, and the Illuminati listened.

We have foreseen the death of our kind. The defeat that lies in wait for them in the line of infinity. Their Doom is not one which we wish to share. We are young, and they heeded us not. So we took our worlds, and we shall save them from oblivion, until the time comes for the multiverse to be restored.

And so it was that many worlds became one.

And the Illuminati watched.

*****

"This world is larger than Earth. There is one continent. It is divided into regions, all intersecting at a singular nexus."

"... The Superheroine's Repast."

Black Bolt nodded. "Such is the story of our escape from the great experiment of the Beyonders."

Medusa nodded and sighed. Black Bolt nuzzled her cheek comfortingly. "So... What should we do now?"

Black Bolt smiled. "For now? I shall stay with my queen."

Crystal, for her part, was puzzled. Clearly, this was a Medusa from another universe—one where she was still a member of the Frightful Four. There was a difference to her personality, though. This Medusa seemed closer to the Medusa that she was before she lost her memory and after she had left the Frightful Four, not the aggressive supervillainess who ran around with their ilk. Crystal smiled.

"You... You're my sister?"

Without warning, Medusa pulled Crystal into a bear hug. Tears streamed down her face, and memories came flooding back. "Oh, Crystal... What have I done?"

Startled, Crystal comfortingly patted Medusa's shoulder. "It's okay. You... You weren't yourself."

Medusa released her hapless sister. "I must find the Invisible Girl. She has to know... I have a family!" Joyfully, Medusa leapt off the building, making her way towards the home of Susan Storm, the Invisible Girl.

Crystal watched her sister as she left.

"What do you want this time, Wizard?" Susan asked, more annoyed than anything. Capturing her had stopped being terrifying after the fifth time, and now it was more of a nuisance than an actual threat.

"We've also noticed that you've been getting rather friendly with dear Madam Medusa, and we simply can't lose her to your side. Medusa leaned back in her chair, sufficiently stuffed to the brim. While she had eaten less than her plumper cohorts, she still had consumed quite a bit of food—enough to serve as three meals for a day, let alone one breakfast!

Her peaceful engorgement was interrupted, however, by her belt buckle, which had started vibrating. Curious, Medusa unlatched it from her belt and opened it up, revealing a video-communicator. On the screen was the Wizard.

"Good morning, Madam Medusa," he greeted, grinning. "I trust you've been well?"

"What do you want, Bentley?" Medusa asked curtly. She did not want to deal with that pompous oafs whining, especially so early in the morning and after such a large breakfast.

The Wizard pouted mockingly. "Why, Medusa, I am HURT. Is that anyway to talk to a friend?"

"You were never my friend. What do you want?"

"Oh, not much. I just wanted to let you know that we miss you here in the Frightful Four and do very much want you to join us for our next caper." The Wizard bowed out, and the camera panned to the trapped Invisible Girl.

"THE RANSOMING OF THE INVISIBLE GIRL!" the Wizard cried out in villainous delight.

Medusa's jaw dropped, mostly because of the sight of her friend captured by the likes of the Wizard but also in part because the Wizard was trying the same hare-brained scheme again.

I suppose what they say about insanity is true... Medusa joked to herself.

"So if you want to make sure that your new friend is safe, you'll know where to find us. Ta-ta for now!" The screen blinked, and the transmission was over.

The remaining two Medusas looked at each other.
