There was a bang, and the Wizard's helmet came clattering into the room and right in front of Medusa and the Invisible Girl. The two looked up to see the navy-clad Medusa standing in the doorway, a bruised and unconscious Wizard wrapped up in her hair. She strode in confidently, and behind her followed two others: the violet-clad Medusa and a plump Scarlet Witch. Dragging behind the violet-clad Medusa was the Trapster, bound and gagged in her hair. The Scarlet Witch held a jar of sand, which could only nab that she had managed to give Sandman a humiliating defeat.

The navy-clad Medusa looked at her hooded doppelgänger and the trapped Invisible Girl and smiled. "Well. If I had known you two were just stuffing yourselves, I might have had a bit more restraint in battle." She poked her hooded counterpart in the belly teasingly, a habit that the hooded Medusa was quickly finding to become annoying.

Why does she insist on doing that all the time? she fumed silently.

The violet-clad Medusa walked up to Susan's cell, dragging the Trapster along with her.

"Open it," she commanded.

"Why should--" the Trapster was interrupted by Medusa.

"Because you've lost, and you're not going to be able to save this plan. You've tried this over and over again, and it's never worked. Stop this nonsense and open the cell."

The Trapster grumbled, then nodded. "It's voice-activated. Mic's on the other side."

Medusa found the mic and, using her hair, raised the Trapster up to speak into it.

The Transfer sighed. "Paste-Pot Pete was a cool name," he said. The cell collapsed, and the Invisible Girl was freed.

There was an awkward silence in the room. Eventually, though, Wanda started laughing uncontrollably.

"PASTE-POT PETE!" she gasped, wiping a tear from her eye. "Oh, God..."

The Trapster frowned. "I thought it was a cool name..."

Within an hour, the police were called, and the Frightful Four were taken away. The five superheroines gave their reports, then were allowed to leave.

"Thank you for the assistance, Ms. Maximoff," the navy-clad Medusa said gratefully.

"Oh, it was my pleasure. Funniest thing to happen all week," Wanda replied, grinning. "I am rather hungry, though. I think I'll go get some dinner."

"Better be careful, dear, or that belly of yours is only going to get bigger," Medusa teased, jiggling Wanda's paunch.

Wanda shooed Medusa's hair away. "Oh, I don't mind. I actually kinda like the new weight. Besides, you're one to talk," she replied, eyeing the navy-clad Medusa's own ample potbelly.

"I think we can all agree that we're all getting a bit fat," Susan chimed, poking her softer tummy.

"It's that restaurant—the Superheroine's Repast. Sweet on the lips, thick on the hips," Wanda joked.

Immediately, all five superheroines stomachs grumbled.

"Maybe we should ALL get something to eat," Medusa suggested.

Little did the Invisible Girl know, however, that an older, seasoned, and plumper doppelgänger of hers was working with a team of the brightest and most influential minds of her world just across town. Their mission? To investigate the nature of the new world that many denizens of other universes had now found themselves in.

Reed Richards, Tony Stark, Namor, T'Challa T'Chaka, Hank Pym, Hank McCoy, Stephen Strange, Blackagar Boltagon, and Susan Storm-Richards were all gathered together in Reed's lab in the Baxter Building. Reed Richards stood at the front, a blackboard behind him and chalk in hand.

"This," he said, carefully drawing on the blackboard, "is what we know was supposed to happen during a normal incursion." Reed stepped back, showing an elaborate diagram of an incursion on the blackboard. "Two alternate Earths phasing into one universe and colliding at an incursion point, resulting in the death of either one or both of the universes from which the Earths hail."

Reed drew another diagram on the board. "And this," he said, stepping aside, "is what happened with our final incursion: multiple parallel Earths joining together into one massive super-world because of the intervention of what seem to be Beyonders, similar to the individual Beyonder that some of us encountered during an event since given the nomenclature of 'the Secret Wars.'" Reed flipped the blackboard to its other side. "And this," he said, writing something on the blackboard, "is what appears to be the focal point of this new Earth."

Three words were written in block letters on the blackboard: "THE SUPERHEROINE'S REPAST."

"Susan, if you will," Reed said, gesturing Susan to come up front.

Susan made her way to the blackboard. "Here's what we know: the current focal point of our new universe was once a restaurant that existed at certain weakpoints in the fabric of the spacetime continuum. There was only ever one restaurant, which allowed it to serve as a nexus point for the various universes that are now part of this super-world.

"However, the restaurant also had an intriguing effect on the populace of each world." Susan smiled. "You may have noticed it."

The other men of the Illuminati looked at each other sheepishly, mumbling incoherently and awkwardly.

Susan, still amused, pinched some belly fat and gave it a jiggle. "Superheroines started gaining weight and getting fat."

The Illuminati all shifted uncomfortably in their seats. Susan couldn't help but chuckle to herself. Here was a group who had faced down the likes of Galactus, and what made them flinch was talking about her weight. Thoroughly entertained, Susan continued.

"Since the formation of the super-world, this trend has continued. Every day, more and more superheroines are going to the restaurant, and they all leave stuffed to the brim after every trip. From our own universe, such patrons have included myself, Alicia Masters, Medusa, and Crystal. Since we learned of the incursions, I have also encountered alternate versions of myself, Medusa, Wanda Maximoff, Carol Danvers, Jennifer Walters, and Jessica Drew. Since I first encountered them, each has gained a significant amount of weight and gone back to the restaurant multiple times, where they display a previously unprecedented gluttony for food.

"However, there is one exception to this rule," Susan said. Grabbing a remote from a table near the blackboard, Susan activated a digital display, which projected a photograph. "Alicia Masters. Since Alicia has gone to the same restaurant, she has not experienced any significant fluctuations in her weight. We don't know why that is.

"We've since linked the existence of this restaurant to the Beyonders. Radiation readings from the day of the incursion reveals a trail of signatures matching the radiation of the Beyonders coming from the restaurant. Based off of this, we can conclude that the Superheroine's Repast is a crucial element to the Beyonders agenda. We don't know why they chose to save our worlds, and that is an ambiguity we need to have an explanation for."

Stephen Strange and Hank McCoy both rose from their seats and made their way down to the blackboard. Susan stepped back, giving Doctor Strange the floor.

He began. "There are two plans of action that the Richardses, Dr. McCoy, and I have discussed. The first is to summon the Beyonders directly and ask them ourselves. I have volunteered my talents for that."

"The second is a bit more experimental," Hank McCoy, AKA Beast, said, stepping forward. "Using a headband I designed to monitor brain activity, we send an agent to the Superheroine's Repast and monitor any potential mental effects that the restaurant has on its patrons. This will be conducted in three phases, which I will let Dr. Storm-Richards explain."

Beast gestured to Susan, who in turn used the remote to change the digital display. Now, instead of Alicia Masters, there were three versions of Susan—the navy-uniformed one standing before the Illuminati, a slimmer Susan wearing a red Fantastic Four uniform, and a Susan in jeans and an oversized sweater.

"Since the formation of the super-world, I have come into contact with these alternate versions of myself. We're all roughly the same age. However, this Susan," she elaborated, pointing at her slimmer counterpart in a costume, "has never been to the Superheroine's Repast. This version," she said, referring to her slimmer counterpart in civilian clothes, "is a regular human being who never became the Invisible Woman. They have both agreed to help us.

"As part of the first phase, I'll go to the restaurant wearing the headband, which will record my brain activity throughout the trip. Accompanying me will be the other Susans, who will also be wearing headbands.

"In the second phase, we'll observe each of us over the next week, keeping track of the frequency of our visits to the restaurant, any fluctuations in our weights, and any potential changes in brain activity.

"In the third phase, we'll analyze the data we have collected after a week and see what results can be yielded."

Beast stepped forward. "In the meantime, Dr. Pym has agreed to shrink down to the subatomic level and observe the new universe and see if he can find a way to potentially reverse the process of our multiverse becoming a super-world."

"Each plan has its own strengths and weaknesses. We all know that. With that said, we have decided to hold a vote to determine which plan we shall implement," Doctor Strange explained. The epidermal displays in all of the members of the Illuminati lit up, showing two checkboxes. "If you would be so kind as to cast your vote..."

"Red Alert to base," Susan said, tapping her invisible comm, "target is in site. Am I cleared?"

"Illuminatus to Red Alert," the Illuminati Susan, "neural headband has been activated and calibrated. You are cleared for entrance."

"Acknowledged. Going in," Susan said. She was standing across the street from the entrance to the Superheroine's Repast. The navy-clad Invisible Woman of the Illuminati, was across town at one of the many Baxter Buildings in this new world. The rest of the Illuminati were there with her. Each of the three Susan's had taken on codenames to help distinguish themselves from one another in conversation. Red Alert was the codename that the red-clad Susan had chosen for herself, although most of the others referred to her simply as Susan-Red. The navy-clad Susan had chosen Susan Illuminatus, ("Illuminatus" for short,) and the non-powered Susan had chosen Susie Q.

Susan levitated herself on an invisible force-field and floated across the street, taking care to hover just above the oncoming traffic. As she made her way to the restaurant, she saw two pudgy women in costume stumble their way out of the Repast with extremely food-stuffed bellies. The first had shoulder-length blonde hair and wore a red-and-blue suit with golden highlights and buttons, a star on her chest, and a sash wrapped around her waist. The second had a head of very fluffy jet-black hair. She wore an unzipped red biker jacket with a yellow design resembling a spider emblazoned on the front, a white T-shirt that could not quite cover her swollen gut, and yellow-tinted sunglasses with red rims.

"Oh, boy, Jess," the blonde-haired woman moaned to her companion. "We really overdid it this time." She put a hand to her mouth and belched.

"That, Carol," Jess said, "is the understatement of the year. And one that's becoming alarmingly frequent..." Jess pinched some fat around her waist for emphasis, giving it a jiggle.

"You said it," Carol replied. "One month of eating like this and I've already gone up a dress size..."

Captain Marvel and Spider-Woman had passed well out of earshot by the time Susan touched down on the other side of the street. Their exchange had left Susan with a bit of trepidation.

Eating here can't be that fattening... can it? she thought to herself. She imagined herself as heavy as Susan-Illuminatus. Was that really what it was going to be like for her after this experiment?

Well... it wouldn't be too terrible, Susan reasoned. She seems perfectly happy with herself. Shaking her head, Susan made her way to the entrance of the restaurant and opened the door.

"Welcome!" greeted a waiter dressed as Spider-Man. "If you'll follow me," he said, directing Susan to a table.

The Spider-Man waiter pulled out a chair for Susan, in which she sat down graciously, and brought a notepad out from a pocket in his apron. "And what can we get for you today?" he asked.

The thinner of the two was a Romani woman wearing a crimson overcoat-like garment, red thigh-high boots, and a scarlet headdress. Her companion wore a black-and-white uniform with a "4" inscribed in a circular black border on her chest and looked almost exactly like Susan—save for the fact that she was a good 35-40 pounds heavier.

Susan's plumper doppelgänger spotted her from across the room. "Oh!" she exclaimed, nudging her companion (whom Susan recognized to be a version of Wanda Maximoff) and directing her attention towards Susan. The two walked over to her table.

"You seem to have a penchant for making friends with me," the plump doppelgänger teased the Spider-Man waiter.

The two members of the Illuminati were going over the data that the first round of trials had yielded. Stephen, having a background in medicine and neuroscience, was studying the brainwave data. Susan, meanwhile, was writing her report.

Stephen pointed at a screen displaying the three Susans' brain patterns. "See that glowing orange spot?"

Susan squinted at the spot where Stephen was pointing. "What about it?"

"That's the only discrepancy between the brain activities of each of your doubles."

"Wait, what?" Susan re-examined the diagrams incredulously. But it was true—for all intents and purposes, the brain activity was exactly the same save for that one glowing spot.

"But what does that mean?"

Stephen leaned back in his seat. "It's too early to tell for sure. But for right now? It seems as though the restaurant isn't really playing any mind tricks on anyone."

Susan took a minute to process this. "Then... What's the link?"

"I suppose we'll find out soon enough."

"Cake. I want there to be cake," Medusa Frightful said.

Medusa Purple smiled. "I see you've taken a liking to the cakes here, haven't you?" she teased.

"Oh, as if you're one to talk," Medusa Frightful retorted. She reached out and pinched Medusa Purple's belly fat with a lock of prehensile hair.

"... Do what?" Medusa Frightful asked.

"Well, is there really a need to tease everyone else about the weight they've put on?" Medusa Frightful questioned. "Not everyone's as comfortable with it as you and Susan are."

"Oh, please. It's not you look terrible with the added weight. And weren't you just saying how useful the 'added insulation' was?"

Medusa Frightful pursed her lips. "... That is true, I suppose," she said.

Medusa Purple nodded her head. Then, suddenly, something caught her eye. It was something that should have been obvious, and was very obvious. But it was so excessively obvious that it had become normal. Just a detail noted unconsciously at the back of her mind. But now that she was on this current train of thought, that little background detail came into focus in Medusa Purple's mind:

Every superheroine in the Superheroine's Repast was stuffing herself silly.

There were a few civilians dressed up as superheroines who were also eating, and a few of them were looking a bit full. But the actual superheroines who fought crime and saved the world on a regular basis were all gorging their bellies taut with food. There was a Captain Marvel having a contest of sorts with a Spider-Woman; a Scarlet Witch scarfing down on donuts galore; even an Invisible Woman—a new one, slimmer and trimmer than the others that Medusa Purple had encountered—was quickly making stacks of pancakes vanish into her stomach.

There was a Rogue making her way through a large helping of grits; a Jean Grey demolishing an entire apple pie; a woman that Medusa didn't know in a gray-and-black costume with a red webbing pattern nursing a food baby—they we all stuffed or getting stuffed. And Medusa could guarantee that those stuffings were going to leave a lot of extra weight on their waistlines.

Come to think of it... Medusa wasn't the only one who had put on weight...

"... Um," Medusa Frightful said, trying to draw her doppelgänger's attention. "Hello?"

"Hm?"

"Are you alright?"

Medusa Purple was silent, then nodded. "I'm fine. It's just... Have you noticed—"

But before she could finish her thought...

Medusa Frightful and Medusa Purple lay on the floor in a stupor, their bellies swollen with food. Between the two of them, they had eaten a box of donuts, a tub of ice cream, and three cakes. Medusa Purple had gone the extra mile and had devoured a fourth, fifth, and sixth cake, but even her larger y stomach capacity had a limit. Now, the stuffing contest at the Baxter Building only had two participants: Medusa Navy and Susan Storm.

Medusa was joyful. Where once her memories were a painful haze, now they were a rushing stream of warmth and love. She remembered everything—the towers of Attilan, the Blue Area of the Moon; Earth-gazing with her husband; Gorgon, Karnak, Triton, Lockjaw, Black Bolt, and, of course, the orange-haired woman she embraced: her beloved sister, Crystal.

"How did you find me?" Medusa asked.

"Your doppelgänger in purple did most of the work, actually," Crystal explained.

"Genetically speaking, multiversal doppelgängers are identical, with a few discrepancies here and there. On an atomic level, though, we vibrate at different frequencies. I assumed that your Crystal would have the same DNA as my Crystal, and just found that DNA signature vibrating on the same frequency as yours," Medusa Purple explained.

Medusa Frightful looked at her. "Somehow, I don't think that could actually work."

"Well, it did."

"Does it really matter how it worked?" Crystal said, giggling. "What's important is that we've found each other again."

Medusa Frightful relented. "I suppose that's true."

Medusa was about to invite her sister down with them when she heard a humming noise approaching the Baxter Building. It sounded almost like...

"... Is that the Fantasicar?" Medusa Purple said.

Medusa Frightful squinted into the sky. Sure enough, there was a Fantasticar approaching them with two passengers: Susan and Reed Richards.

They were a bit older than the Richardses any of the Medusas knew, and dressed in blue uniforms that dreamboat more modernized versions of their classic costumes. Reed had a bushy bed with a white streak on the chin, and Susan was considerably more slender than any Susan the Medusas had seen in the past month or so.

The Fantasticar landed on the roof of the Baxter Building. Crystal and the Medusas watched in fascination as Reed and Susan stepped out.

"Hello," Reed greeted. "Is this the Fantastic Four of this world? Because this is the third or so Baxter Building we've seen so far."

Medusa Purple stepped forward. "Well, it is a Baxter Building for a Fantastic Four. But there are a few Fantastic Fours on this world."

"Why is that?" Susan asked.

"I'm not entirely sure. What I do know is that there were a series of multiversal collisions known as incursions taking place that were destroying alternate Earths, but ours and a few other Earths were saved by two beings known as Beyonders."

"Wait a minute—are you saying there are living Beyonders on this world?" Reed asked, incredulous.

"As far as I'm aware, yes," Medusa Purple answered. "Why are you so surprised?"

"Because I thought that the Victor Von Doom of my world killed them all."

The group was greeted by the Spider-Man waiter when they entered.

"You two must be new here," he said to Susan-616 and Crystal. "Welcome to the Superheroine's Repast!"

"I'm new here, too," Reed piped up.

"Yes, yes, of course," the Spider-Man waiter said, dismissing Reed with a wave. He turned his attention towards the white-clad Susan. "And I know I've seen you before. The usual, Mrs. Richards?"

"Yes, please. It should be enough for all of us to start with."

"Splendid! Right this way, please."

The Spider-Man waiter led the group to a large table, where plates of food were already being carted over. Fried chicken, hamburgers, fries, and—of course—chocolate cake. The group sat down.

"Help yourselves to whatever you like. I know I will," the white-clad Susan said before digging in.

Her belly began to strain against the tight yellow fabric of her clothes as Crystal devoured burger after burger in euphoric glee. Crystal had managed to stuff herself quite nicely by the time the first course was done, and eagerly asked the Spider-Man waiter for a second course of cake.

The white-clad Susan was ravenous. She managed to pack away two fried chickens, twice the number of burgers that Crystal ate, and enough chocolate cake to service a wedding. It was no wonder how she had gotten to be so large after seeing just how much food she ate—the fastest metabolism a woman could have would still be unable to process all of that food and not gain five pounds. And this Susan had already put on 65.

Reed simply ate a burger and was satisfied.

Susan-616, for her part, wasn't nearly as passionate as the other women in her group.

"Was the food as good as you said, or were you holding back?" Reed asked Susan.

She shrugged. "It was good food, certainly, but not good enough to gorge myself on it."

"Hmm..." Reed thought for a minute. "I want to run some tests on this food. There's something about this world that's very peculiar."

"Tell me about it. I don't think there's a single superheroine here who isn't a little pudgy other than Crystal. And even then, with the way she was eating, it's only a matter of time."

"Shall we to the Baxter Building?"

Susan looked at her husband. "Isn't that taking advantage of our host?"

"This really has me bothered."

Susan shrugged. "I suppose we can."

***


Meanwhile, back at the Superheroine's Repast, Crystal and Susan-White were still sitting at the table. Crystal massaged her swollen belly.

"I don't think I've ever had a meal like that," Crystal groaned.

"I've had a few," Susan-White replied cheekily, giving her tremendous gut a slap. "In case you couldn't tell."

"If I keep coming here, I don't think you'll be the only one."

Susan-White chuckled. "Honestly, I think you're in the minority here. I've seen a lot of superheroines come to this place and leave with a few extra inches on their waists."

Crystal nodded. "I don't blame them. The food here is so good."

Susan-White nodded enthusiastically in agreement.

"You want some more?"

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
"Well, that's interesting..." Reed said.

"What is?" Susan asked. She walked over to her husband's lab station.

Reed stepped out of the way and gestured to the microscope he had been using. "Take a look."

Susan examined the slide. On it was a sample of the burger--broken down and liquefied with a chemical and mechanical process facilitating human digestion. She adjusted the nobs to focus the view, but...

"I'm not much of a nutritionist, but I don't think there's anything all that spectacular about this burger."

"Precisely," Reed stated. "There's nothing unique about it."

Reed removed the slide from the microscope and set it on a glowing surface--a Holo-Analyzer. Reed tapped a few holographic keys, and the Holo-Analyzer ran a diagnostic test of the burger. After a minute, the Holo-Analyzer projected its results for the two intrepid scientists to see. Sure enough--

"NO ANOMALIES DETECTED."

Susan frowned. "But if it's not the food, then what's--"

"Making the superheroines get fat?"

Reed and Susan turned around to find themselves face to face with... Reed and Susan. Or, rather, a Reed and Susan.

These two were clad in black-and-white uniforms, with Reed being clean-shaven and Susan being--unsurprisingly--quite plump. It had been the white-clad Susan who had called the attention of her blue-clad doubles.

"I take it you're the Susan and Reed who live in this Baxter Building?" the blue-clad Reed asked.

The white-clad Reed nodded. "You had an Illuminati on your world?"

"Memento Mori," Reed answered.

The white-clad Reed nodded in acknowledgement. "Illuminatus."

"Do we know the answer?" the blue-clad Susan asked.

The white-clad Susan nodded. "It's simple, really. It's more a question of motivation than anything."

"Alright. But that doesn't answer the question. Why are the superheroines of this world getting fat?"

The white-clad Susan smiled. "Because we like it."
1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.title: Meanwhile with Reed and Sue...

In the middle of the night, Medusa-Purple finds herself back at the fridge.
1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
Susan looked at her reflection in the full-size bedroom mirror.

Earlier that day, she had found herself in this exact position, self-evaluating after an incredibly hectic week. While she knew that many would have disagreed with her (some more respectfully than others), when she looked in the mirror, the image that stared back was one that Susan found mediocre. A trivial concern, to be sure, but a less-exhausting change of pace for the haggard heroine.

Now, though, whatever gripes she had with herself had all but disappeared. Stranger still, Susan's change in attitude could be traced back to one minor, temporary alteration in her physique:

Her belly.

In the time between her first inspection and this current examination, Susan and the rest of the Fantastic Four had shared their first meal with Ben Grimm's girlfriend Blair. Ben Grimm was a man known for many things, but his culinary prowess was more muddled in infamy than esteemed in fame. And yet, the ever-lovin', blue-eyed Thing had surprised Susan by preparing an absolutely delectable spread--a decent portion of which had found itself crammed into Susan's stomach.

Which brought her to her current ponderings. While many people wished that their midriffs would shrink back and flatten out, Susan was... intrigued by its roundness and heft. For whatever reason, the more Susan examined her bloated self, the more attractive she felt. And the fonder she grew of her bulging belly... the more she wondered what she'd look like if the rest of her was just as big.

"I couldn't... could I?"

A sudden rumble from her belly drew her attention back to the present moment. Amazingly, Susan was hungry. And there was only one thing she craved to satisfy that hunger--ice cream.

"I really shouldn't," Susan said to herself, rubbing her belly. But the image of her with a jelly-belly just wouldn't leave her mind... and only got more appealing by the moment.

"... Well, I can always lose the weight if I don't like it." And thus, it was decided--

Susan Storm was going to get fat!

***

"It wasn't long after that when I went to the Superheroine's Repast for the first time," Illuminatus--the white-clad Susan--continued. "I'd gained a decent amount of weight by then, but my progress only accelerated after I started eating there regularly."

"Well, that makes sense for you--you were actively trying to get fat," the other Susan replied. "But how does that explain everybody else?"

"If you'll allow me," Reed interjected. Illuminatus stepped back to let her husband forward. "For the past few weeks, our version of the Illuminati had been conducting an experiment to test Susan--sorry, "Illuminatus"--'s theory..." Reed then went on to explain how they gathered the alternate Susans and monitored their brainwave activity and weight fluctuations during regularly scheduled visits to the Superheroine's Repast.

"Since we began, only two Susans displayed significant changes--the two who also operated as the Invisible Woman," Reed continued, projecting a holographic display of the three Susan's involved in the experiment. Suzy-Q was relatively unchanged from the start of the experiment, but Illuminatus had gained another 15 pounds, and Red Alert was now sporting a soft, cushy potbelly. "Those two Susans also enjoyed the food more, as we could tell from the readings their pleasure centers gave out."

"And just in my normal life, I've noticed alternate versions of superpowered women I know--myself included--who, if they hadn't gone there already, started getting much rounder in the middle after a trip to the Superheroine's Repast," Illuminatus added.

The bearded Reed scratched his beard. "So, to summarize--we're currently on a patchwork planet put together by two adolescent Beyonders made out of alternate Earths from our--mostly destroyed--Multiverse, and the reason that these Earths were saved was because they all had costumed superheroines who had the desire--or at least, the potential--to get fat?"

"... Yeah, pretty much," Illuminatus said, shrugging. "Nailed it right on the head." Her stomach growled audibly. "Are you two done with that burger? I'm feeling a little peckish."

Susan handed the burger to her double, who gratefully dug into the meaty meal.

"But if the worlds were saved to prevent there destruction with the rest of the Multiverse," Reed pondered, "... then what happens now?"

"What do you mean?" his clean-shaven doppelganger asked.

"The Multiverse was saved. Susan, the children, and I are rebuilding it.*"

"That's why we came here," Susan added. "This was the first time we'd seen a world that had survived the incursions, and the second time a patchwork world was created.**"

Illuminatus and her husband looked at each other. "Then... shouldn't the Beyonders' experiment be over by now?"

"Not quite yet."

***
*See Jonathan Hickman/Esad Ribic's Secret Wars for more, true believers!
**Secret Wars again, and the Secret Wars: Battleworld tie-ins! Excelsior!

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
A pair of green eyes slowly fluttered open, and Medusa Purple discovered that she was currently standing in front of one of the Baxter Building's many fridges. Okay "standing" might be overselling it a little given that it was more like she was simply laying limply in midair, while a few strands of her red hair had braced themselves against the floor in order to support her weight.

She also soon guessed that those same strands of red hair had probably decided that it would be a fun idea to take her sleep walking out of her bed and into this kitchen in the first place.

"Very funny..." Medusa groaned as while she had complete control of her hair whenever she focused her powers, that didn't mean her crimson locks didn't show a few signs of a general subconscious sort of behavior now and again.

"I'm still feeling full from last night's dinner, lets just go back to bed..." Medusa insisted as her hair lowered her booted feet to the ground. As they did so however one strand of her hair gently began to thread itself through the refigerator's lever and pulled it open.

Inside Medusa could see that the Fantastic Four were clearly storing a great deal of food from the Superheroine's Repast, including another of those chocolate cakes she loved so much. Just seeing it was enough to make her mouth water and her stomach rumble as if suggesting that maybe it did still have room for a few more pieces.

"Well if you really insist..." Medusa sighed before allowing her hair to extend and grab a slice chewing down on its rich chocolate frosting and softly moaning at just how exquisite the taste was!

"That looks like fun, can I join?" Asked a somewhat familiar voice...

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
Medusa smiled. "Not at all, sister."

She scooted over to make room for her sister. With her prehensile hair, Medusa cut a slice of cake onto a plate for her sister, who gratefully sat down and accepted it. Crystal picked up a spoon from a nearby counter and dug in. One bite, and her eyes lit up with delight.

"I don't know what it is about this food, " she raved, "but it's FANTASTIC."

Medusa agreed. "I must admit, it has become one of my favorite pleasures of late."

Crystal nodded fervently. "Mine, too. I've been getting such a belly lately," she said, pinching her tummy for emphasis. "I've put on at least 15 pounds at this point."

"I know what you mean. I haven't weighed myself in a while, but I had gained about 25 pounds last time I checked." Medusa hesitated. "It's probably gone up since then."

Crystal smirked, sucking some frosting off of her spoon. "If we keep this up, we're gonna be fat in no time if we're not already there."

Medusa paused mid-mouthful. She looked down at her belly, swollen with adipose and bulging from behind her nightgown. "I suppose you're right, sister." Medusa solemnly set her plate down. "May I be honest with you?"

Crystal halted in her eating, surprised. Medusa went on.

"I'm still not quite sure how I feel about the extra weight."

Crystal cocked an eyebrow. "Really? But you seem so confident about it..."

"I am a Queen. Part of my duty is to appear as a stalwart figure--an immovable pillar unfazed by fear," Medusa said. "Appearing confident is no issue for me. Feeling confident, though, is a very different issue."

Crystal reflected on her older sister's words for a moment. "I suppose that makes sense. Still, I don't think it's that large of an issue." She smiled reassuringly. "You're beautiful at any size."

"Everyone certainly seems to think so." Medusa sighed. "And yet, I still can't accept it completely."

"Well, it's not like you're the only superheroine who's been putting on weight recently. You're not even the only Medusa who's been putting on weight recently.. Besides," Crystal said as she picked up her spoon and savored more cake, "life's too short to not enjoy food this good."

Medusa chuckled. "Perhaps."

The next morning Medusa Purple and her sister Crystal decided to head out for the Superheroine's repast in order to help themselves to another nice meal. They weren't the only slightly pudgy pair of sisters to be going along either, Medusa Frightful and her version of Crystal were going to accompany them.

Medusa Purple couldn't help but be amused at the fact that the somewhat younger version of her sister who was along for the ride was much less experienced with the human world than either she or her own sister proper and so the newest Crystal tended to keep looking this way and that getting quite easily distracted as she tried to take everything in at once.

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
"*BURRRRRRP!* Oh..." the smaller Crystal moaned. Medusa Frightful's sister rubbed her greatly swollen gut to alleviate the intense pressure from all of the food she had just packed into her stomach.

A stack of pancakes later, she was joined by her doppelgänger, who simply pushed her plate away with a groan and stretched out in her seat to accommodate her bulging belly.

Amateurs, Medusa Purple joked to herself before cutting herself her fifteenth slice of cake that meal.

The four women had been enjoying quite the veritable feast for breakfast for about half an hour at this point. Both Crystals had each initially ordered a small (if filling) plate of pancakes, but once those were gone, they were quickly followed by seconds. Then thirds. Then fourths, then fifths...

The Medusas, for their part, had no illusions about how much they were going to eat. They both ordered two plates of pancakes and three servings of chocolate cake right off the bat.

Medusa Frightful let out a mighty belch. "Excuse me," she said, patting her belly. She reached over for another slice of cake and managed to eat her way halfway through it before she stopped with a groan.

"Done?" Medusa Purple asked.

"I can't eat another bite... No matter how much I may want to."

Medusa Purple nodded sympathetically. Truth be told, she'd been feeling full for a while, now. But the food was just SO GOOD that she just had to eat it.

Even still... it'd be a shame for all of this to go to waste.

In addition to two slices of cake that Medusa Purple had ordered for herself, her doppelgänger had left behind a plate stacked high with pancakes and a chocolate cake. Medusa brought all of those dishes to her seat and dug in.

The pancakes were the first to go--thick, buttery, and drenched in syrup. Medusa felt each morsel explode on her tastebuds and stuff itself into her gullet. Despite her fullness, each bite left her eager for the next. She brought her fork down for one more nibble, but found that she had licked the platter clean, somewhat disappointingly. Her mood instantly changed when she made her way to the final course--the cakes. Nine-and-a-half slices of rich, fluffy, baked chocolate perfection just waiting tantalizingly in front of Medusa to be consumed. Medusa licked her lips and dove in with gusto, savoring every molecule that passed her mouth.

With a mighty groan, Medusa set down her knife and fork, pushed back her chair, and began to massage her engorged tummy with her arms and her hair.

"That was quite the display," her sister said.

"I don't think I've ever seen anyone eat that much in one sitting," said Medusa Frightful.

"I wish I could eat like that," said the other Crystal. "Honestly--it's almost a skill with you."

Medusa merely burped contentedly. "Excuse me."

"You're going to need it," remarked a voice from behind. Medusa turned around to see the plump, navy-clad figure of the Susan of her world.

"Oh, good morning, Susan," greeted Crystal. "Would you care to join us?"

"... What do you mean, 'I'm going to need it'? Need what" Medusa asked.

Susan smiled wryly. "It's the only way to restore ourselves into the Multiverse."

Medusa cocked an eyebrow, confused. "What?"

Susan sighed. "The Beyonders have no intention of restoring the worlds that make up this patchwork planet. Not unless you go through one last trial."

"Me? Why me?"

"I couldn't say. But the Beyonders have spoken. In order for our worlds to be returned to the way they were, you have to participate in a contest."

Medusa mulled this over. It was a heavy piece of information to take in. The fate of the world--no, the fate of many worlds--now depended on her. And all she had to do was...

"What kind of contest?"

Susan pinched her nose. "You're not gonna believe this..."

"Susan."

"... Right." Susan took a deep breath. "It's an eating contest. If you can manage to eat the most food, the Beyonders will restore everything back to normal."

Medusa's jaw dropped. "That's it?"

"... Yeah. It's... yeah."

"... But if it's a contest, who am I competing against?"

Susan looked up at Medusa. She opened her mouth to answer:

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
Medusa took a moment to digest the information. On the one hand, the entire thing was utterly ridiculous--these interdimensional "Beyonders" possess powers and abilities far beyond those of even immortals, and they go out of their way at every opportunity to get women to eat inordinate amounts of food? They essentially take over the universe, and this is what they do with that power? Really? Save reality from a destructive experiment perpetrated by their elders--and for this? And now the fate of multiple universes is going to be determined by a contest where two women eat enormous amounts of food? Really? THIS is what her world had become?

On the other hand, it beat non-existence by a long-shot, and if all she had to do was eat more food than her friend to restore the Multiverse, it wasn't that bad. Better than a fight.

"Have you had breakfast yet?" Medusa asked Susan.

Susan's stomach grumbled hungrily.

"I see. Have some breakfast. Then we'll go to this contest."

"You don't want to train first?" Susan asked.

Medusa slapped her belly, causing it to jiggle slightly. "Susan, my dear--I've been training for the past few months."

***

"Ready?" Crystal asked her sister.

It was mid-afternoon at this point. The two stood in the vom of the World Amphitheater. Beyond the shadowy entrance, Medusa could make out the roar of the crowd gathered together by the Beyonders for the contest.

"As anyone can ever be," Medusa answered.

"It's only three rounds. You can do it."

"Honestly, sister," Medusa said, rubbing her belly, "I just want to eat. I feel incredibly hungry."

Crystal smiled. "Same," she chuckled, patting her own growing gut.

A fanfare resounded through the Amphitheater.

"Good luck." Crystal gave her sister a hug.

Taking a deep breath, Medusa walked out into the center of the Amphitheater. Cheers resounded loudly as the crowd saw their champion. From the other side of the field, Medusa could see Susan. The two met in the middle, where the Spider-Man waiter stood with an additional referee uniform over his costume. Eventually, the noise of the crowd died down, and a thunderous voice boomed throughout the Amphitheater.

Citizens of the world! We are from Beyond! From annihilation, we gave you salvation! From salvation, exhibition! And from this exhibition, we shall see if we give you restoration!

"Long-winded bunch, aren't they?" Susan whispered. Medusa snickered quietly. Susan pointed. "Spider-Man's not too happy about the referee's outfit."

Medusa squinted in the direction of Medusa's finger. Sure enough, a red-and-blue figure sat, arms crossed in a huff, the lenses of his mask aimed squarely at Monsieur Spider-Coach.

"Most of them aren't," noted Medusa.

Today, these two champions shall partake in a triathlon the likes of which has never been seen in this or any universe before--an EATING triathlon! Whosoever vanquishes their opponent in the rounds to follow shall win the contest and determine the fate of reality.

At the blowing of the trumpets, the first round shall begin--a round of speed!

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
The nature of the "speed" contest was fairly simple, Susan would start at one end of a table, and Medusa would start at the other end. The entire table would be utterly and completely covered with food. Medusa and Susan would both need to clear every single dish in front of them, and whichever heroine managed to eat her way past the halfway mark of the table first would be declared the victor.

It was easy to say... but not so easy to do.

Sadly Medusa did't have much time to contemplate what sort of a strategy she might want to use to try and win this round, all she could really think about was just how wonderful the food laid out before her smelled and how hungry her stomach was feeling.

The whistle blew and the contest began.

Instantly Medusa's hair lashed out and wrapped around a tray containing a cake pulling it over while still other strands of her red main worked to wield a cake slicer to cut the confection into more reasonably sized pieces and start to consume them one by one.

Risking a glance upwards in between chews Medusa could see that Susan was doing something similar when it came to cutting a cake of her own apart with the aid of her invisible forcefields.

The red haired inhuman queen couldn't help but smile to herself slightly, her hair reacted to her on instinct, while Susan's forcefields were a much more concentration based powers, as the two women continued to chew their way through this meal Medusa was certain that Sue would start to have a much harder time using her forcefields after she finished stuffing her face with a dozen or so plates worth of food.

For moment Medusa focused on the one obvious task in front of her, eating to her hearts content...

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
The two women were three-quarters of the way through the table when they began to feel full. All Medusa wanted to do was fall back against the table and give her distended gut a massage. Even with her regular binges and superhuman stamina, Medusa was fast approaching the limit of her capacity.

"Ohhhh..." she groaned, stuffing a slice of cake into her mouth. She gave her tight belly a soothing rub.

Across the table, Medusa watched as Susan sluggishly made her way through a bowl of pudding. While Medusa had managed to get an early lead, Susan was a foot or two closer than Medusa to the halfway mark. However, even she was slowing down.

Medusa quickly assessed her situation. She was bigger than Susan, given her height; but Susan's stomach was more used to large stuffing sessions. The two were evenly matched. Except...

Medusa squinted and noticed a glint under Susan's nostril. Thin, red, and trailing...

"... Blood."

It made sense--Susan had been using her powers continuously for hours--she must be exhausted. Medusa was a different story. Her powers were physically manifested. They were extensions of her body. She could use them without getting tired.

Her determination renewed, Medusa gorged the rest of the cake, every morsel making its way into her gullet.With one hand constantly rubbing her belly, Medusa attacked the rest of the food in front of her, stuffing mouthful after mouthful into her mouth and down into her ever-growing paunch.

After a while, the two superheroines were neck-and-neck, the halfway lines just inches away. The fate of a dozen worlds depended on Medusa's ability to eat her way to victory, but even her reinvigorated momentum had slowed down. Just as she was about to lie down, though, Susan collapsed--unable to eat another bite. Medusa pressed on.

"And the winner is... MEDUSA!"

Cheers erupted throughout the auditorium. Medusa beamed with pride, raising a hand to wave to the crowd before bringing it back down to her mouth.

"*BURRRRP!* Ohhhh..." Medusa moaned, rubbing her round, bulging belly.

"Not very royal of you," a weak voiced chuckled.

Medusa turn to see Susan, sitting up awkwardly.

"I am still Inhuman," Medusa replied amusedly. "You were a worthy opponent, my friend."

Susan smiled. "Just be glad I didn't have my husband's powers. It would've been a much different story, then."
1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.title: As their bellies grow full both women slow down...

1521211222112211212121111222211121211122.content:
"There will be a few changes going into the next round of the contest..." The Beyonder announced as both Susan and Medusa turned their attention to the near all powerful figure behind their current contest.

Almost instantly the feeling of bloated fullness lifted from Medusa's shoulders and her belly decreased in size slightly, looking over at the shocked expression on Susan's face it was clear that the Invisible Woman had likewise just had the contents of her stomach magically vanished, transported, digested, or whatever it was exactly the Beyonder had done so that the pair of pudgy superheroines would be able to continue their contest.

"However that is not the only change that must take place before the next round will begin. In the second round you will each be given your own stockpile of food and whoever can eat more of it before they must admit that they are full will become triumphant, if you go an entire sixty seconds without taking a full mouthfull of food you are automatically declaring that you are full. Also, just to make things extra interesting, we will have your powers adjusted slightly....

Food flooded the tables--sweet foods, savory foods, rich foods, indulgent foods. Despite her earlier complaints of being stuffed to the brim, Medusa's appetite returned with a force. Her stomach rumbled, her mouth watered, and all she wanted to do was eat, eat, EAT. She reached out with her hair to grab a tiramisu cake--

And nothing happened. Her hair lay limp.

"What--?" she began, when suddenly a devastating blast of energy ripped through the table, reducing it and its contents to rubble.

Medusa's hands immediately clasped over her mouth. She looked around the coliseum to see if anyone was hurt. The blast almost hit the spectators in the stands, but, to Medusa's relief, had been stopped by a protective field that redirected the blast harmlessly into space. She spotted her husband in the crowd, standing next to--no one.

***


Where is Reed Richards? she asked Black Bolt through their telepathic bond.

He's standing right there, isn't he--? Black Bolt turned to his left, but if he expected to see someone, they were not there.

"But I swear, I could--" As soon as the words left his mouth, it dawned on Black Bolt and Medusa what had happened to them.

"... Black Bolt, was that you?" an incredulous, disembodied voice asked. Without warning, Reed Richards's head flashed back into existence, hovering over the ground next to where Black Bolt stood.

Black Bolt gave Reed a curious look, then removed his cowl. His hair, normally slicked back, began undulating like snakes.

"It appears our powers have been switched with those of our wives."

***


If I have Black Bolt's powers, than that must mean... Medusa turned around.

At her table, Susan was making the most of her new stretching abilities, wrapping her long arms around piles of food and scooping them into her mouth, stuffing the contents into her swollen, balloon-like belly, which simply grew bigger to accommodate the sheer mass of her gorge.

... I have a lot of catching up to do... Medusa thought, cramming a piece of tiramisu into her mouth.

To make things especially interesting, you will each be doing battle with the powers that allowed you to win one of your previous rounds, so Medusa will have her prehensile hair while Susan Richards will have her husband's elastic powers."

Medusa felt life and feeling returning to her hair, but she knew that even with the way it allowed her to eat quicker than without it, it still wouldn't quite be enough on its own, if she was going to win this contest than she'd have to act to keep Susan from being able to stuff her stretchy stomach.

Already plans were starting to form in Medusa's mind as to how best go about tackling this final challenge....

Victory was the last thing Susan wanted. If they had any hope of restoring the world--the multiverse, even--back to some semblance of normalcy, that would be dependent on her ability to lose this contest.

Unfortunately, this determination to be defeated conflicted with two things: the honor of competition, and her craving for the food.

She couldn't help it. The food from the Superheroine's Repast was truly irresistible, and the food that the Beyonders conjured up for this contest was even better. It practically exploded in her mouth with the most pleasurable of flavors, delighting every taste bud on her tongue with its rich delectablility. Eating it was an experience, one that made her feel so good, so full, and so... big.

Susan had to admit: she loved gaining weight and getting fat. She loved feeling her belly soften and grow, swelling with every bite and redistributing every extra calorie across her formerly slim frame. She wanted to swell up like a balloon, and with her husband's powers, that only got easier.

Plus, this was a contest: it wouldn't be honorable to just throw it. Susan just hoped that Medusa's drive to win would be stronger than her own desires.

The trumpet sounded, indicating that the round had begun. Susan licked her lips, stretching her arms out a particularly scrumptious-looking pile of desserts in front of her. She wrapped her hands around them and brought them to her awaiting maw, closing her eyes in anticipation.

Then, without warning... her hands were empty. Susan opened her eyes to find not a collection of pastries and sweets, but crumbs. She looked around... only to see Medusa, her prehensile hair holding the very food Susan herself had intended to eat. With breakneck speed, Medusa inhaled the stolen goods, her already hefty belly bloating out further with each bite.

Susan smiled. "Clever girl..." she said.

And so the contest processed as such: Susan reaching out for large quantities of food, and Medusa snatching it away before Susan could eat it. Sometimes, Susan would prove too fast for Medusa, but that only served to invigorate the Inhuman Queen and her determination to win.

With Susan sufficiently incapacitated, a now exhausted and very bloated Medusa plopped herself down in front of a pile of sweets. There was still time left on the clock, and she had a lead to maintain if she wanted to win this contest once and for all. She grabbed a large cake and stuffed it in her mouth, using her free hand to give her swollen belly a soothing rub. She could almost feel the inches and pounds get added to her waist as she ate, making her ever so slightly bigger and heavier.

Eventually, the trumpet sounded, indicating the end of the contest. Medusa collapsed to the ground with a groan, rubbing her overtaxed gut. Her belly stuck up like a large, round, spandex-covered balloon of fat and food from her abdomen, taut with an insane amount of calories yet soft to the touch with adipose.

The next few events were a blur. After untangling Susan and restoring her regular powers, the two were then weighed--really? She's gained THAT much?--and Medusa declared the winner by a 12-pound margin. The two women were reunited with their families and loved ones, and soon, the Beyonders went to work restoring the worlds of their patchwork planet to their original states.

The process would take the better part of a day, (these Beyonders were young and inexperienced, after all,) so the denizens of this world returned to their dwellings with the promise of awaking in their old homes they next day. Farewells were exchanged between friends from across universes, and when night fell, Medusa wanted nothing more than to lay in bed with her beloved Black Bolt.

"You saved the world, my love," he said in the mindspace they shared, wrapping his arms around her prodigiously plump potbelly.

The bloating had gone down from the contest, but it was still quite large and somewhat sore. Black Bolt's hands massaged Medusa's midriff in gentle circles, lightly kneading the soft layer of quivering, jelly-like flab with his fingers.

"It wasn't so hard, husband," she replied, moaning a little as he continued pampering her. "All I had to do was eat. I've had a lot of practice with that... as you can tell."

"It suits you, I think."

"Really?"

"Well..." Black Bolt's hands took on an electric energy as they made their way down Medusa's belly, "I certainly enjoy it."

Medusa shivered with pleasure as she felt her husband's advances. "In that case..." she said, biting her lip. "You're going to have to convince me." She turned to face Black Bolt and drew him into a kiss.

***

Medusa woke to a new day in a new world, refreshed and reinvigorated. Black Bolt lay silently in bed, clearly exhausted from the night's... activities. The Inhuman Queen yawned deeply, stretching the drowsiness from her body. She scratched her tummy absentmindedly, but something felt... different. Shrugging, Medusa got up and made her way to the bathroom in their room in the Baxter Building. She caught sight of herself in the mirror and almost did a double-take.

It seems the multiverse wasn't the only thing the Beyonders restored...

Of course, in the realm of superheroes, "normal" was thrown out the window right at the gate. Such had been the case when alien scientists came down and experimented on Medusa's ancestors, such had been the case when four astronauts developed strange abilities after getting microwaved (or, rather, "cosmic-waved") in an interstellar storm, and such had DEFINITELY been the case when these two women from such fantastic backgrounds bonded with each other over fattening multiversal feasts.

So of course it was while Medusa and Susan waited for breakfast to be ready that things quickly went off the rails. Susan had decided to make pancakes for the two of them, a process that grew more and more aromatic as it went on. The two recounted the events of the past few months to each other as Susan cooked, but the two were interrupted by the inevitable hungry rumble of a belly.

"Sounds like someone's hungry," Susan laughed, giving her belly a pat.

"After all the food we consumed on that world, I'm frankly shocked I can still get hungry," said Medusa, rubbing her own soft midriff.

"I'll say this, it'll be a while before I get this tummy back in shape."

"Yes," Medusa agreed, grabbing a handful of belly fat. "It will certainly take some time for us to lose all this--"

"Oh, I don't mean it like that," Susan interrupted. Medusa shot her a quizzical look. "I'd like to gain the weight back."

"... Really?"

"I liked being fat! Don't tell me you didn't."

Medusa was about to answer her, but then stopped to ponder her question. Aside from minor inconveniences, there hadn't been anything really bad about her heavier days. She'd certainly enjoyed eating good food.

"... I suppose I did not mind it. And the effects were mostly cosmetic, ultimately."

"And besides--those dinners sure were fun."

Medusa smiled. "I foresee quite a bit more of them to get you where you want to be."

"It'll be so much fun to watch myself gain it all back."

"Why wait?" an impish little voice called out.

Susan and Medusa's bellies both grumbled, but this time with an odd twist--they bloated out in front of them.

"What strange manner of...? Medusa began, utterly confounded.

"Oh, jeez..." Susan sighed. "What do you want?"

With a cartoonish pop and a purple cloud, a weird, green, alien-looking jokester with pointed ears and a big grin appeared in front of Susan and Medusa, hovering over the oven. Even with all the things she had encountered across her storied life, Medusa still needed a moment to take in the sight of this strange being.

"Who...?"

"What do you want?" Susan repeated. She seemed more wary than anything.

"Why should the Beyond-Bores have all the fun?" he said. "If superheroines want to stuff themselves silly and get fat and happy, then why not let me help out? Here, have a taste!"

The little green man snapped his fingers, and a large stack of pancakes appeared in front of Medusa, suspended in midair. She opened her mouth to ask a question, and the pancakes immediately flew in, cramming themselves into her mouth, down her throat, and into her gullet. Medusa burped, and her body fattened up in response.

"Or maybe you wanna slim down, get nice and trim?"

This time, a giant straw appeared above the Inhuman queen, and Medusa suddenly felt herself get slurped up out of the top, hang in the air for a good three seconds, and land with a thud on the floor below when the straw winked out of existence. Dazed, she looked down and found herself back to her original figure and weight.

"ANYTHING'S possible with the Impossible Man!

Medusa stood up and dusted herself off, but as she did, her body reinflated to how it was this morning. She looked over at Susan, who appeared to have gone through the same thing, but with a much duller sense of surprise. Susan returned the look and sighed, but this time with a little more bemusement.

"Here we go again, I guess."

Of course, she didn't let the prisoners exercise when they wanted. It was only once a month and in a large arena where she could watch all the inmates jiggle around her special obstacle course of humiliation.

And it was coming up in a week.

Grinning, Excella spared one more glance down at the bloated and stuffed heroes, itching to see just how much weight they would put on between now and the exercise/obstacle course day.

It seemed like between how long it took for the girls to get into their new costumes and the increasing length of time that it took them to get just about anywhere these days thanks to their increasingly bulky bodies no sooner had the three superheroines finally managed to change into their new costumes than they heard the bells start to ring announcing that it was time for lunch.

The trio of tubby superheroines waddled their way back into the kitchen in the process shocked to discover that the sweet scent of all the food that was being cooked up somehow overwhelmed the sense of fullness that they had all been dealing with and left them salivating and hungry for a chance at getting their hands at plenty of whatever it was that smelled so delicious.

It didn't take them long to find their seats as they just had to look for Medusa's long flaming red locks, for some reason none of the superheroines even imagined that they'd be sitting anywhere at the lunch table other than by their respective cell mates. Once they arrived at the table however they were shocked to discover two things.

One of them was that Tigra was no longer sitting at the table. Instead she was laying on her belly and eating a great deal of meat (it looked like enough to have come from one entire fully grown cow in fact!) out of one bowl and drinking water out of another. She looked up at her fellow superheroines, and it was just possible to detect a few faint traces of a blush upon her furry face.

"What can I say, getting my big fat furry ass on the table seemed like too much of an ordeal so why not make myself at home down here? It's not like I'm cold or anything with all this fur and fat to keep me warm." She pointed out.

Susan doubtlessly would have objected to seeing a fellow superherione demean herself in such a matter but there was the other surprise she had to deal with first. Sitting next to Medusa, Titania, and Emma were three huge plates piled high with just about every form of food imaginable which the supervillianesses were quite obviously ignoring.

As if she as a piece of metal being drawn by a magnet Sue felt compelled to sit before the plate next to Medusa but slowly gazed up and down at in silence unsure what to make of the huge collection of food.

"Something the matter Invisible Woman?" Asked a short sharp voice form behind her.

Susan slowly turned her now rather ponderously pudgy body around and found herself gazing a short woman in a well trimmed suit.

"I was just wondering what all this food is doing here..." Sue admitted not sure how to address the first thin woman she had seen in a long time.

"Ah, well to put your mind at ease, I am Warden Excella Danforth, and as for what all that food is doing on your plate its your lunch..." She explained without so much as batting an eyelash.

Susan slowly turned around to gaze at the veritable mountain of a meal behind her and then back to the warden. "I'm not sure I can eat that much." She admitted feeling awkward about how the Invisible Woman who had become powerful enough to face down Doctor Doom himself was feeling skittish about one huge pile of grains and meat.

"Well it's prison policy that you do!" Excella said while taking a step forward to wrap Susan's bloated belly with her right hand.

"The lot of you are still dangerously thin as far as I'm concerned. I haven't had any escapes from my prison and I'm determined not to break my perfect record. The fact that you used to be a superheroine doesn't change things, so now that your body has had some time to adapt to larger meals its time to take it to the next step, eat up!"

Susan once again slowly turned around and gazed at Jen and Kitty both of whom were sitting spellbound by the massive plates of food before them. None of them had taken so much as a nibble at the moment as if waiting to see what their defacto leader did.

Susan herself wasn't sure of what she was going to do, she still felt somewhat full but the food smelled so tasty and she didn't want to create a scene either....

Everyone was meant to have a certain percentage of body fat, whatever was doing this to them was seemingly radically increasing that percentage and their bodies were adapting to compensate; the majority of the hunger they were feeling was simply their bodies trying to drive them to get “back up to weight” similar to people who had been starved or undernourished for some time, backing this up was the way the rest of their bodies were being altered to compensate for what was now to be their new “natural” state.

Their skin was becoming tougher, their bones, muscles, tendons and connective tissue reinforced; this was happening to all three of them but was especially prevalent in Val, presumably because at her younger age her biology was more plaint than either her mother or Uncle. These changes would allow them to remain mobile, and counter most, if not all of the harmful side effects of their increased weight, but also resulted in them gaining physiologies not totally dissimilar to the mutant Frederick Dukes aka The Blob...essentially on top of whatever powers or abilities they may already have, his wife, daughter and brother-in-law were becoming what was commonly referred to as Bricks...if anything that...jiggled quit that much when it moved could really be referred to by a name quite that solid...

The end result was that whatever weight they ended up, would be their “natural” weight...so even if they somehow managed to crash diet their was down to the weight they had before, they would in fact be dangerously UNDER weight with all the potentially lethal health problems that could imply...frankly they almost certainly die before they ever reached their former weights...

Despite Lyja being a Skrull and biologically completly different from himself, Reed was seeing similarities in the changes in their respective physiologies, that lead him to believe they might be heading towards similar destinations, though what those might be he had yet to fully determine...

Taking out a wadded up and sweat drenched copy of the Charter of Costumed Agression, Titania double checked the vacation clause. It turned out that they could attack during a vacation with impunity, the only thing the villians needing to look out for being the retaliation from the heroes.

So Titania plotted and planned with her teammates. Each would take a member of the Sumo Six on in single combat, incapacitating them as best they could, giving the Frightful Sumos the perfect opportunity to strike at the guests of the Six.

Titania ordered each member of her team to a part of the resort, suited for the talents of each Frightful Sumo.

Finally the plan was set in motion, Titania observing all from her post at her hotel room.

The first match was Iron Maiden vs. Miss Massive by the pool.

Miss Massive scored the first attack, ramming into Iron Maiden and sending her to the ground. Luckily her armored form protected her from most of the damage and she got to her feet.

Next it was Iron Maiden's turn to collide with Miss Massive. The two sumo sized combatants tussled for awhile but eventually Iron Maiden gained the upper hand through clever use of her exoskeleton.

Miss Massive was panting, sweat pouring from her body as she got to her feet on wobbly legs. She pointed a finger at Iron Maiden, almost summoning her weight power but was stopped by a steady stream of milk entering her mouth.

"GLUG!" was all Miss Massive was able to say as more and more milk entered her mouth. On and on the flow went, the amount of milk actually causing Miss Massive's gut to expand. Still Iron Maiden kept the flow going.

Finally, after twenty minutes of milk, Iron Maiden stopped.

Miss Massive was looking more like a beached whale than a superhero. Her fat arms were unable to reach her stomach, full as it was with milk. But what was worse than the fullness of the milk was the effect of Iron Maiden's powers, causing Miss Massive to feel as if every square inch of her body was full of her favorite food: pizza.

"Massive Down," Iron Maiden reported.

The second match was between Moonstone and Wobbly Webshooter on the beach.

Moonstone got the first attack off, a belch of energy that sent Wobbly flying. Wobbly managed to send out a few strands of webbing and hit Moonstone, but the added poundage didn't slow her down. Instead, Moonstone took the pounds with a smile before punching Wobbly hard in the gut.

Woozy, Wobbly Webshooter tried to fire another web but was cut off by Moonstone's hand touching her belly.

"Let me help you with all that weight!"

Moonstone then abosrbed as much flab as she possibly could from the dazed hero, her own body expanding to an incredible size as Wobbly slimmed down. Unfortunately for Moonstone, her powers only allowed her to absorb four hundred pounds at a time, leaving Wobbly at three hundred and fifty pounds of hero. Still that was nothing compared to Moonstone's new weight and the villian easily knocked out the hero, tying her up and placing her in a nearby shack.

"Wobbly tied up," Moonstone reported.

The third match was Yellowjacket vs. Bumble Bee at the bar.

The two rivals started of slamming their flabby bodies together but soon enough switched to pixie size, dodging the other's blasts as they flew, fat bodies jiggling all the while.

Yellowjacket led Bumble Bee on a chase, dodging the shoes and other objects of the citizens all around until she suddenly dove upward. Bumble Bee, going far too fast to make a correction in time, slammed into the counter of the bar.

Seizing her opportunity, Yellowjacket laid on the pollen, making Janet soak up the stuff.

As Yellowjacket watched her rival revert to human size and started attacking the bar, she reported in.

"Bumble Bee bloated." Such was indeed the case, as Bumble Bee had already snatched up a hose of beer and was sucking it down like her life depended on it, causing her stomach to bloat out and large belches to escape her mouth.

The fourth match was Lady Bullseye vs. Fat Cat at the hotel lobby.

The two traded multiple blows but neither was really hurt thanks to all the blubber both women had. Next, Fat Cat shifted into her tiger form, roaring as she charged Lady Bullseye. Dodging, Lady Bullseye kicked out a leg.

But Fat Cat had already shifted into her kitten form and scrambled up the outstretched leg, scratching Lady Bullseye and drawing blood.

Cursing, Lady Bullseye gave a might belly bump, sending the kitten Fat Cat tumbling through the air.

By the time Fat Cat was on her feat and in her normal form, it was too late.

"I challenge you!"

Against her will, Fat Cat assumed a sumo stance, Lady Bullseye doing the same. They slammed against one another, Lady Bullseye the victor. As soon as she lost, Fat Cat felt an immense hunger, her stomach roaring louder than the Invisible Blimp could belch.

But Lady Bullseye wasn't done yet. Pointing to Fat Cat and a slim civilian trying to avoid being seen, she spoke. "Both of you sumo, now! And after you've both lost ten times, go stuff yourselves!"

As Lady Bullseye watched the first match end in Fat Cat's victory, she reported in.

"Fat Cat sumoed out."

Instantly both sumo sized opponents grappled, the force of their impact causing the hall to shake. Titania turned into her Red She-Hulk form, overpowering She-Bulk for a few minutes before She-Bulk got angrier. Soon it was She-Bulk who was overpowering Titania.

Roaring, Titania tried to match that strength but was unable to. Defeat seemed a foregone conclusion in Titania's facial expression before the villian smirked.

"I just remembered what makes Red Hulks especially dangerous!"

She-Bulk then felt her strength fading as Titainia asborbed it, leeching the gamma radiation from the hero's body, soon enough leaving just a fat Jennifer Walters with regular human sumo strength.

Knocking the human Jennifer out with a flick, Titania tied her to a chair and stuck a funnel full of weight gain shake into her mouth, laughing as she departed, locking the triple reinforced steel and titanium door she had custom made for her hotel room behind her.

"She-Bulk reverted," Titania reported, a bit disappointed that she wouldn't be able to view the final match.

"This goes for you too Susan. Don't waste any food and eat as much as you can, got it?"

Reed, much like his wife, was the first to enter the building and also the first to meet Titania.

"Hello Mr. Fantastic. Did you see what I did to your wife? She's safe and sound in my little vacuum prison. If you want her back safe and sound, follow me!"

"Ben, Johnny, don't follow me. Scout the area for the other Frightful Sumos and do not separate, understand?"

Ben and Johnny nodded and watched as Reed walked away, stretching himself to go farther faster.

Once Reed had vanished from their view, Ben and Johnny went east, into the tall isles of the bakery. They traveled for half an hour with no sight of any enemy. What they found instead was a massive table loaded with pastries. The pastries were donuts and crullers of various shapes and sizes, all slathered in yellow frosting with what looked like cinnamon on every one.

Ben, feeling a bit hungry, took one and bit into it.

As soon as he did so, laughter rang out all around both men.

"Hahahahaha, oh rocky boy, you just made the biggest mistake of your life!"

Nightshade's face appeared on a monitor in one of the aisles, her many chins wobbling as she observed The Thing start to eat uncontrollably, his blue eyes glazed over as pastry after pastry was demolished by his hunger.

"What did you do to him?" Johnny demanded, turning into his flame form just in case.

"It wasn't me. One of my teammates used her special pollen on all those pastries. Your friend will be fat in no time and out of the picture. Now, what should we do with you?"

The monitor went black then, Johnny taking the air, not wanting to leave Ben to his fate, but knowing there was nothing he could do for him.

Johnny had flown a hundred yards when a fat woman flew right in front of him. He knew from Susan's information that this was Moonbelcher and shot a blast of fire towards her.

Belching loudly, the energy blast from her mouth ripped through Johnny's flame and struck him so hard he fell out of his flame form, striking the ground hard.

Woozy but still conscious, he got to his feet and managed to burn Moonbelcher right on her fat butt.

"YEOWCH! Why you little firebug!"

Moonbelcher readied another blast but Johnny was gone.

Cursing, Moonbelcher informed her teammates over their earpieces.

"Don't worry, Moon, he's in my sights," one of her cohorts replied.

Johnny was looking around for another opponent, not realizing that he was heading towards a pit much like the one that had trapped the Sumo Six in the first place.

Taking a step, his foot plunged through the floor.

With a splash, the Human Torch, was in a giant chamber of milk.

Still in his flame form, Johnny wasn't worried as his flaming mouth served as a barrier to any of the liquid entering him.

He attempted to swim but suddenly felt as if he had swallowed a bowling ball.

"Don't try to move, Human Torch. You're in my milk bowl, after all."

Johnny looked to the left, where the voice had come from, and saw Iron Maiden walking towards the glass tank, placing her hand on the surface. Despite how full he felt, Johnny concentrated and increased his flame, but the fullness only increased.

"Tell me, Torch, what does fire do?"

Johnny was too full to reply and Iron Maiden smiled.

"It consumes anything it comes into contact with. You're evaporating my milk and breathing the fumes in, silly boy."

Johnny burned brighter and brighter still, the glass in the tank starting to crack.

Iron Maiden's eyes knew fear then as she backed away, knowing that the power of Johnny Storm's Supernova technique was too much for the tank.

But soon enough the flame died out, Johnny exhausted from his full body.

"Titania, this is Maiden. The flame is out, repeat, the flame is out."

Titania, standing in front of Reed Richards, grinned as she heard the news.

"Looks like you're the last Fantastic Four member left, Reed old boy."

"Cut the antics and show me where my wife is!"

An extended fist almost caught Titania in the jaw but she had ducked, striking back with a belly bump.

Reed countered by turning into a human sized rubber ball and slamming into her again and again.

But, much like his wife, the technique proved useless against Titania. Still Reed didn't become dizzy, Mr. Fantastic long used to being able to meld his elastic body. After dodging one another for several minutes, Reed finally managed to land a hard punch to Titania's gut, knocking the wind from her lungs.

Bounding away, Titania was breathing heavily and clutching her middle.

"Huff...Huff...you're better than your wife at being elastic, Richards, I'll give you that. But you've made me angry and you....wouldn't like me when I'm ANGRY!"

Before Reed's startled eyes, Titania became a Red She-Hulk, her fatty fist pounding into his head and knocking him out.

Titania grinned and picked up the vacuum containing the KOed Susan Richards.

"Join your wife for awhile Reed, you'll be seeing a lot more of each other when you both wake up!"

Titania started laughing then, a great, booming, victory laugh that would have been the envy of evildoers everywhere if she wasn't still panting from exertion.

"Phew...this fat girl needs to take a breather. Then back to my special guests!"
